reviews.text: I&#39;m so disappointed in the size of the portions lately, the last delivery was the last straw. Not only have prices gone up, portions are half the size of what they were a few months ago. My $22 salmon salad was half the size of a Panera salad. I was totally shocked since I used to order salads from here religiously weekly and they keep shrinking. Their chicken piccata dish has been completely inconsistent ranging from 2-3 &#34;pieces&#34; of chicken which resemble a tenderloin. The pasta is usually stuck together, sometimes the piccata sauce is on top, sometimes the capers are missing, sometimes the pasta is double, sometimes it comes in an appetizer box and sometimes it comes in a massive box with the wrong lemon butter sauce. I&#39;ve had different variation of mushrooms. It&#39;s the most inconsistent meal to the point I can&#39;t believe I wasted $50 last night and walked to the supermarket an hour later to buy a frozen pizza.

Cheesecake Factory is lucky I&#39;m giving them 1 star.  The reason is because the waiter was nice and charismatic but then he kept forgetting about us.  But that doesn&#39;t mean they&#39;re getting 4-5 stars from me.  First of all, we didn&#39;t get the complimentary bread like other people did, the fried  calamari was over fried and full of oil, it was disgusting.  I couldn&#39;t even get through one calamari without feeling nauseous simply because I could the taste the oil, not good at all.  Second, it took them an hour to get our orders served and the excuse was &#34;the salmon was overdone and they had to throw it out&#34;.  I ordered a grilled salmon salad which includes radish, kale, quinoa, Brussels spouts, walnuts and avocado.  Yep, my dish was far from that, I was lucky if it got 4 thin tiny slices of radishes, not to mention, no avocado, Barely any walnuts and 2 Brussels sprout slices which might as well, just don&#39;t give me anything.  So disappointing!  I&#39;m honestly not a huge fan of big chain restaurants, their food is frozen and over processed.  I love small local businesses/restaurants because the food is fresh, compared to places like this.  Back to Cheesecake Factory, we weren&#39;t even  didn&#39;t asked if we needed refills for our beverages, so basically we had to finish for the ice to melt in order to drink &#34;water&#34;.  I came here because my dad wanted to and I didn&#39;t want to be once again &#34;the picky one&#34;, well this is the reason why! <br><br>Dear Cheesecake Factory, please don&#39;t try reaching out to me, I&#39;m really not interested in your frozen food.

My food was cold. It took the waiter Chelsea P.... 25 minutes to come back to the table. I had to ask another staff member for a To go box. Never came back to ask if we needed anything. I won&#39;t be returning.

This was my first time eating at Cheesecake Factory, and probably will be my last. The steak I ordered was supposed to be median rare, but it came luke warm and stiff as a plate of hard boiled chicken breast. The mashed potato was chunky and dry. I dare say I was served microwaved food. Service was slow (we did not get a water refill or a chance to voice our displeasure at the steak until very late, when we were almost finished. Even then, we had to ask for a refill specifically). If other people had good experience here and the horrible food + service was just me, then I will add that the waitress and staff are being racist against Asians. All in all, this was one of the worst restaurant food I have ever had.
Love the food, love the drinks, if you can forget the calories cause even the skinny menu is not really &#39;skinny&#39; but it is worth it.

I came here for both lunch and happy hour with my girlfriends. The lunch options are similar to dinner - decently big portions. <br><br>The happy happy specials are a great deal for drinks and appetizers. <br><br>We had the cosmo and glass of Pinot - decently good. We had the fried Mac and cheese balls, crabmeat &amp; spinach dip, mini pork belly sliders and regular burger. All were delish. <br><br>The waiter staff were friendly and checked to see if you need anything else.<br><br>Overall, I would definitely come back for happy hour, lunch and/or dinner. Lunch gets pretty busy and crowded from 12-1pm.

Cheesecake Factory...sooooo don&#39;t know if I can logically give it less than a 4. Came in for just a slice and it was painless. No upsell, quick service, water, etc.<br><br>The booth across from us wasn&#39;t cleaned up, but that&#39;s just me nitpicking. <br><br>It had no affect on our experience at all. <br><br>We also got way more whip cream than expected.<br><br>Treat yoself.

Cheesecake Factory used to be my favorite.  This one is a huge joke.  They charge $24 for a tiny entree, and the manager not only didn&#39;t address my issue with it, he tried to upsell me on buying extra sides to compensate for the fact that the entree was so tiny!  Lol what a joke

The food wasn&#39;t as exciting as once was for cheesecake.  It&#39;s become  too fast food driven and the service received reflects on that.  Build your own omelette and requested avocado on the side got us a huge plate that was sitting under a heat lamp baking the little pieces of avocado... Hot avocado?!? Gross! Smokehouse BBQ burger was good but it was to come with crispy onions that were more oil  than onion.  <br>Finally waitress asked if we had room for dessert, I asked for black out cake to go and she repeated to confirm.  3 mins later she drops off the check and gives her farewells.  No cake! Granted, she didn&#39;t charge for it either but I definitely asked  for it smh.  <br>All in all, it&#39;s changed with time and they aren&#39;t that high on my personal list anymore.  I won&#39;t be back.

Wow .... when I say last nights dinner was a disappointment... it was a disappointment!  <br>I wanted to buy something delicious for my family and automatically thought of The Cheesecake Factory.<br>I don&#39;t want to write down a lengthy review however  I arrived for pickup waiting for the manager to get of the phone while there was another server in the back I guess cleaning up.. and after 5 minutes of waiting he is off the phone and I tell him my name he gives me two big bags of food I was so excited I was about to share this delicious food with my family. <br>Fast forward we are eating the food of course we had to warm up the food because it was cold.<br>The food had to no favor, the pasta had no sauce and the chicken parmigiana sandwich had the two smallest pieces of chicken in it ( more bread than anything) smh what a disappointment <br>To make matters worst my mom was eating her broccoli and chicken pasta we substitute the rigatoni with linguine and she stops and pulls out a long white string out of  her mouth !!!! Disgusting... could&#39;ve been a piece of cleaning rag could&#39;ve been a string to hold meats together ... who knows !!!! Alll I know is that not sanitary and from that point on the food went to the garbage $100 plus down the drain .... the presentation of the plate when you open them plus everything I mentioned above .... brings me down to the fact that I willl never waste my money at that location again !!!!

Very good place we tried the spicy chicken chipotle pasta in the chicken pot stickers with some white wine and pineapple cherry limeade it was amazing each dish was so well made it had so many flavours. The interior and ambience is pretty good as well it&#39;s a good place to go on a date. And the cheesecake oh my God we tried the chocolate mousse cheesecake and it was amazing it is like heaven in your mouth must try.

Don&#39;t come to this place at all! If you&#39;re ordering something to go, you will be waiting about 30 mins to an hour. There is only cashier there and he/she has to go to the back and get all the orders to bring back to the front. They take forever. I called to place an order for a pick up and once I got there they didn&#39;t start it. I was waiting almost an hour for the guy to put whip cream around the cheese cake and requested that he redo it because it looked sloppy and it didn&#39;t look presentable. This wasn&#39;t the first time this happened. This place doesn&#39;t deserve any stars.

I have been to this Cheesecake factory a couple of times when I was consulting in New Jersey. Overall it is a pretty good place to get a nice lunch. Compared to other Cheesecake Factories I have been to this one is fairly standard (but not in a bad way.)<br><br>First let me say that whenever I come here it has always been uncrowded. This I assume is because I come during business lunch hours and people don&#39;t want to worry about waiting on food for a long time. The irony of this is that since people don&#39;t eat here the food actually comes out fairly quickly when I go. <br><br>Since this particular restaurant is huge, but isn&#39;t particularly crowded when I go, the service has also been good to me. I don&#39;t have any complaints about rudeness or lack of attention when I have been here.<br><br>What I can say though is that the food is great. Like a lot of cheesecake factories they have a huge menu and the dishes are fairly high quality. The pasta dishes in particular are some of my favorite. A long with the main entries they have also have amazingly fluffy and sweet brown bread for free! I am sure anyone who has been in a cheesecake factory before can attest to how great these are and it makes paying a little bit extra for the restaurant feel worth it. <br><br>I have always liked the Cheesecake Factory chain and this particular branch seems decent. I would recommend this place if you have an hour lunch and are willing to spend a little extra for great food.

Went here as a last resort. Food is tour standard typical chain restaurant but a bit more flavorful. Had the bread and butter brough to the table. The aervice here was spectacular. Ordered the cajun spicy pasta substituted the bowtie pasta for angel hair... delicious! Also ordered chicken with rice and beans. Went there later, eo it was very calm. Good delightful experience and meals came out promptly.

Yo, how is the name of the place Cheesecake Factory and your plain cheesecake is garbage. The food doesn&#39;t even matter cause the name is Cheesecake Factory and I expected something out of this world. But y&#39;all got Cheesecake all the way f@@ked up. You make Juniors look like Caviar. Either way, I had to toss yo sh!t in the trash after the first bite. My first time will be my last.

The stars are mostly for the decor and drinks. Food and service, not so much.  Never a good sign when they seat you and your table is only partially set.  No knives, no s&amp;p, and one dirty spoon. I get it, it happens - but when you ask your server for a knife for the butter and she brings a steak knife it reflects on the management.  The staff isn&#39;t properly trained here. <br><br>My real problem was the food. Clam chowder so salty I believe they used sea water when making it.  After she served it too me, she came back and said &#34;it isn&#39;t hot, right?&#34; before I could even complain.  She served it knowing it wasn&#39;t hot! She took it back and came back a moment later with a bowl so hot the chowder was scorched...from the microwave!  They microwaved my soup!  <br><br>Turkey Dinner sandwich had to better, right?  Turkey, stuffing, cranberry, gravy -- yum, right?  It would have been if the gravy they put on it wasn&#39;t straight out of the refrigerator!  <br><br>Details matter when you run a restaurant.  In this place the details don&#39;t seem to matter.  Tipped the server 25% as I don&#39;t blame her -- but her manager is asleep at the wheel.<br><br>Dessert of pineapple upside down cheesecake was served with so much whipped cream you literally couldn&#39;t see the cheesecake., which is too bad because the cheesecake was quite good.

I ordered online to save waiting time but instead ended up waiting over 45 minutes to receive my food. I arrived about 5 minutes earlier than the pickup time stated on my confirmation email but there was a line to pay, so by the time I paid, it was about the stated pick up time. I stood by the counter and waited but no one told me when my order was delivered to the front. They didn&#39;t announce any of the names on the orders that were delivered to the counter. They could have at least sent a confirmation email that my food was ready. After waiting patiently and seeing that others who arrived after me had received their food before me, I asked for my order, to find it had already been sitting there! I am highly disappointed. Food is cold and portion is smaller than dining in. Waste of time and money.

Horrible service. Waited 45 mins for a table to have dinner with my child and his food literally came out before I even placed my order. The server basically put his food in without waiting on my order. Then my order comes out with a garnish I specifically asked twice for the server to have the chef remove. Like unreal. I didn&#39;t even get to eat a morsel of my meal. The manager, Daisy then comes to the table and really could care less and blames it on the time of day and that they are winding down for the night - LIKE WTH does that even mean!? You&#39;re open give great service and that&#39;s it - despite Covid despite anything, take accountability!

Been at this location several times and also did take out.<br><br>At height of the lunch hour, it can take time to get seated, served, eat and pay. So if don&#39;t have more than an hour, you may want to wait til dinner or happy hour time. As a table of 2, 3, 4 or larger, we have never been in an out within an hour.<br><br>Fresh baked bread is good - multigrain is better than the regular. <br><br>Menu: Big menu to choose from, so you can&#39;t go wrong with almost anything you order.  There is a skinnylicious menu if you are counting calories, lunch special, regular dishes...<br><br>Chicken pot pie was ok, a bit too much liquid - have had much better<br>Fish and chips - too much batter on the fish...but decent<br>Pasta da vinci - chicken w/ mushrooms in madeira sauce is good <br>lunch specials are good if you can&#39;t eat a full meal or saving room for dessert. <br>Burgers are decent and fairly big. <br><br>Dessert: Cheesecakes are very heavy and most of them are too sweet. Unless you have a sweet tooth, go for regular with whip cream.  Black out chocolate cake is good with the almonds on the side. <br><br>Note: Tip calculation on the bill is based on the total, instead of subtotal.  should be based on subtotal.

Occasion:<br>Casual lunch<br><br>It was one of the days I craved pasta for lunch! So a colleague and I went to Cheesecake Factory to fulfill our pasta starvation! <br><br>Overall:<br>Maybe it&#39;s because I didn&#39;t expect much from Cheesecake Factory but to me the food was actually more than decent! We shared 1 Jambalaya Chicken linguini and 1 huge quac with chips. The portion was so huge that we were so full and couldn&#39;t finish all of them. <br><br>Highly recommend: <br>Jambalaya Chicken Linguini<br>Two kinds of linguini - regular and green - were covered with delicious sauce! Chicken was cooked perfectly - charred outside but juicy and tender inside! Definitely get this when you get a chance! But only large portion is available for this dish so recommend sharing among at least 2 friends <br><br>Guacamole with chips<br>Even though it&#39;s not anything special - the chips are freshly fried and guac was well flavored! The portion is more than enough to feed 3 people.

This is a chain restaurant so if you are craving a Cheesecake Factory meal and/or cheesecake then you&#39;ll find that here. I&#39;ve eaten at quite a few due to chain&#39;s penchant for being near places I visit around the country.  I like the chain (the bread is so yummy!)so I&#39;m not knocking that. I&#39;ve gotten one of their frozen cheesecakes (about $37 or so) at this location for a party and it was a hit.  After my fourth disappointing dinner visit at this Jersey City location, however, I&#39;ve concluded that it&#39;s definitely not a place that I would consider a local&#39;s dinner destination. <br><br>Most of the eating places in the mall close at 8pm or 9:30pm. That means the CF ends up being the only place open. CF closes just after midnight (at least according to the times on the door). The last three times were between 9pm -- 10 pm. Service and the food itself has ranged from good to terrible.  There has been the smell of dirty dishrags (fishy smell someone else mentioned, I think) each time that I&#39;ve visited. I almost walked out today but I was thinking Tex Mex rolls would hit the spot. Ended up getting my other CF favorite- the Cajun Jumbalaya. <br><br>Maybe the late time is a factor in why things aren&#39;t representative of what I usually experience when visiting a Cheesecake Factory. Maybe I&#39;m just a cranky pants each time? I don&#39;t know. The waiters before and the manager today seem sincere when I mention it but, sorry, there&#39;s been no improvement.<br><br>The food/service inconsistency, its price point and Chipotle being just outside the mall (stays open late)means that I&#39;ll pass on this location unless I have a need for cheesecake in NJ. If my stomach says it doesn&#39;t want Chipotle or a craving, I think I will take it to go or tell it to wait until we are home.
The food is great but the service is too slow. The waiter and waitress are not attentive.

First time at the Cheesecake Factory and I must say the food does not live up to the hype. Spicy chipotle chicken pasta was alright taste wise, a bit heavy on the greens and peas and light on the pasta and chicken. My girlfriend ordered the Cajun shrimp pasta dish that had to get sent back because there was chicken pieces inside (we asked for shrimp and no chicken). We reordered the five cheese pasta with shrimp and it was once again nothing special a 5/10, literally 3 pieces of shrimp. For the Hefty price tag the food was underwhelming and in the same category as cheap diner food but x3 the price. <br><br>On the other hand, the desserts alone are worth coming back for. We got the Oreo dream cheese cake and the chocolate truffle layered cake. The portion was more than generous and taste was so rich and in depth. <br><br>Cons: Mediocre food and service (waitress acted very bland and wanted her shift to be over, we sat by the register and heard one of the waitresses make a loud sigh while walking. How in professional can you get?)<br><br>One major thing despite being very dark in there, you can see how dirty all the plates and silverware was. Hard water on everything and chucks of left over food. The table was very sticky and messy as-well. Disgusting. We had to wet our napkins and re-clean everything. <br><br>Steer clear from this place and just order some desserts for takeout. Save yourself the time and headache.

Our Server was so great, and food was delicious. I just wish the hostess was a little more gracious. We called and they said they didn&#39;t take reservations, it was walk in only, but half hour wait. So we get there, put our name down and party. Larger parties were going in, and we asked a few times, how much longer, it was always 5 more, 10 more... in total we waited ONE HOUR AND FORTY FIVE MINUTES. Completely unacceptable. But to the rest of the staff working: thank you.

Would not recommend coming during the holidays. My boyfriend and I decided on date night here because we had a gift card, but we regret it and wished we had saved it for another time. We of course expected it to be a little hectic and took that into consideration; however, the only thing that was okay about our visit was the easygoing server. We never got bread to start since &#34;the kitchen had burned the last batch of the night&#34; and our food took 45 minutes as &#34;something was overdone.&#34; I heard this excuse given to 2 other tables. Everyone around me had grimaces lol and did not look like they were enjoying their meals. Once we finally got our food, my pasta carbonara was dry as hell. My boyfriend&#39;s brick chicken was still slightly over-charred and there was nothing crispy about the crispy potatoes. The food took so long that we couldn&#39;t even order cheesecake to go. I&#39;d be willing to try out this place again in a couple months to hopefully avoid this experience again.

&#34;food was not up to mark... others cheesecake outlets offer great taste&#34; <br><br>It was my brother b&#39;day dinner party and we decided to come here. I have been to 5-7 diff cheesecake factory so I know its safe bet instead to try new place<br>We got our table giving it was Saturday but our server was bit slow. She took almost 45 minutes to bring our food and all the tables were not occupied.<br>In the appetizer, we ordered sushi and dumplings and it was good<br>In entree, we ordered orange chicken, Jamaican black pepper shrimp, bang bang chicken and shrimp and fresh grill salmon.<br><br>I am not sure but all were blunt in taste and u have tried black pepper shrimp in West Hartford, CT, so I was not sure chef was not capable to make it worth or what. We did not enjoy our food that much.<br>Cocktails were good but prices were on bit higher side. Means $14 for one mojito.??? <br>Never Less though to say ambience. It was good. And yes, thanks to them to singing happy b&#39;day song for my brother

Update to my previous rating. I went back to the Cheesecake Factory to give them another chance after the slow service last time. <br><br>This place is awful! I got take out to avoid the poor service all together. And what do I get, at the bottom of my edamame there is A HUGE FUCKING DEAD BUG!!! So disgusting. Will never go back here. Ever again.  They clearly don&#39;t care about their customers. Who knows what other unsanitary conditions are in this kitchen!!

I don&#39;t know is it just me or not. but we come her at least once a month. but the last 3 times was a nightmare. while the food was good . service was terrible, tonight we decided to try our luck again. after we got sat down . we waited a full 15 minutes and not a single server came to ask for drinks or greet us. this time I&#39;m sick of it . me and my wife just grab our jackets and walked out the door. probably wont go back for a very long time.

I&#39;m not a fan of chains...and even less a fan of mall eateries. That made my experience at this Cheesecake Factory all the more (pleasantly) unexpected.<br><br>My friends and I had some time to kill before a movie on the third floor. We were banking on a wait of at least half an hour, but were greeted and seated right away. The server was friendly and quick to take our orders, though deciding from the massive menu wasn&#39;t easy. <br><br>We split an order of calamari. While the coating was too thin, the squid was nicely chewy without being overcooked. Unfortunately, the cocktail sauce side totally lacked zing.<br><br>While my two friends went after the chicken romano (a plate-sized chicken cutlet with a mass of spaghetti in a pesto cream sauce), I went &#34;lighter&#34;: beer battered fish tacos. In a chain known for comically oversized portions, this meant 4 soft-shell tacos with chunks of battered white fish larger than the shell and served with a cilantro-lime rice and stewed black beans. It was tasty and had a nice pickled vegetable garnish.<br><br>We capped the meal off with a slice of blackout cake. Like everything else, this was an absolutely massive piece of chocolate cake held together with chocolate icing, chocolate ganache, and chocolate chips, topped with almonds and served with whipped cream. The three of us managed to get through about half of it.<br><br>Granted, I think we lucked out with timing, but this was an all-around positive experience.

Wish they&#39;d stop being so stingy with the sauce. The drinks do not get you drunk or even tipsy, I wonder if they even put liquor in them for real or.  The food is good tho and it&#39;s not really busy during the week.

Dear Lord!!!!! <br>I swear <br>Worst CCF in the country. <br>I think I&#39;ve been to about a dozen in the USA<br>This place is so bad, that female brunette manager is the one giving this place the bad reviews. <br>There&#39;s always a problem at this location. <br>$7 a slice of cheesecake and the cake was so small, and had remnants of it wiped on the side. <br>Good came out cold, <br>Hard to eat cold French fries, it was terrible. <br><br>I gave this place 2 chances<br><br>The gen mgr which is a male helped us last time.<br>He was acting like a manager<br>And i hate having to ask for a manager. <br>I&#39;m not a big complainer<br>Most restaurants fix the problem mostly the servers. <br>This is the WORST location. I really am not a complainer. I&#39;m so passive. <br><br>Definitely don&#39;t take a date or celebrate a special occasion at this one<br>Go to another.

The strawberry martinis here absolutely give me life ! As well as all the cheesecake they have which is amazing i like the turtle or pumpkin when the mood strikes... the food is also amazing pictured is the honey truffle chicken over mashed potatoes and asparagus

Cheesecake Factory in general is an underwhelming place for New Yorkers. However, outside of New York, it is a great place to catch up with friends and family and feel a little bougie doing so (without spending the bougie bucks). <br><br>The food overall, is average. However, three things you MUST have at any Cheesecake Factory. Bread, Fried Mac and Cheese Balls, and Cheesecake. I recommend the the celebration cheesecake, but that is just me. <br><br>The staff in any cheesecake factory makes you feel like you are in the Disneyland (once again, without the expenses). Whenever I want to catch up with friends outside of New York, you betcha I am going to a cheesecake factory. Especially after I had a good two hour session at the gym.

I used to like cheese cake factory a lot but it seems the quality is deteriorating. We were there yesterday Nov 11, the food tasted great  however, the table was dirty, the utensils dirty, the host at the door was unfriendly.

Best cheesecake factory I have been to! Not a fan of this chain because I have had bad experiences, but this location has been the best. Located in the lower level of Newport Mall, this location was clean and the staff was very attentive. We had the pasta with fried chicken and the sweet corn tamales. Both good, but the sweet corn tamales were delicious. Definitely have always been my favorite thing on their menu. My son had the pizza lunch special that came with a side salad. Also very good. Would recommend this location.
Love it, i tried the Thai chicken mango and it was delicious I don&#39;t remember if that was the name of the plate but it was worthy.

Went to Cheesecake Factory for brunch since we were out shopping in the mall.  <br><br>I ordered the Monte Cristo.  The french toast was not cooked through and was completely soggy.  The potatoes were burnt to a crisp and were inedible. <br><br>My wife ordered Fettuccine Alfredo with shrimp.  The pasta was extremely undercooked and just plain hard.  The shrimp were the only part of the meal that were properly cooked.  <br><br>My daughter ordered spaghetti and meatballs with butter and parmesan on the pasta instead of sauce.  We got the same hard, undercooked pasta with no meatball.  When we asked for the meatball, it came out pink inside.<br><br>We called over the manager.  She only replaced the meatball, was visibly annoyed and asked &#34;What do you want me to do?&#34;.  The second meatball was also undercooked.  <br><br>I didn&#39;t want to cause a scene in front of my daughter, and realized none of this would be made right by the manager, so we left our food uneaten, paid and left.<br><br>The server, for what it&#39;s worth, was extremely friendly and earned her 20% tip.  She was smiling and joking with our daughter and made us feel welcome.  She was definitely a bright spot.<br><br>I will not be returning to this location.  Management just doesn&#39;t care at all.  Not even an apology for an entire ticket of food that wasn&#39;t cooked properly.
Awesome! The food was great the location was beautiful. We sat immediately, no wait time. It was just how i remember it.

Had a great time on my most recent visit to the Cheesecake Factory. We went on Tuesday night around 7:30 pm and a wait for 2 was less than 10 minutes. There were a decent amount of open tables so I am not sure why there was a wait but we didn&#39;t really mind. <br><br>Our waitress, Ottaviana, was probably one of the sweetest waitresses I have ever had. She offered great suggestions from the menu (which can be overwhelming) and brought the food out not too soon but not too late either. Would highly recommend asking to be in her section if you come here!<br><br>We got a piece of cheesecake to go (regular cheesecake with strawberries on top) and it was delicious! $10 for a piece of cheesecake is a bit absurd but we were just living in the moment.

Having been to Cheesecake Factory many times, this is probably my last time dining here. Check out what they charged me $14 for: these must be some really expensive eggs and bread. <br><br>Not to mention I waited half an hour for this. <br><br>The chef must hate me with his guts.

I have been to Cheesecake Factory a couple of times in other cities and this one really disappointed me. In terms of portion and quality although service was good. Me and my husband ordered one appetizer of Avocado Toast and an entree of Tuscan Chicken. We split the entree to two. <br><br>Avocado Toast- 1/5  <br>      It is one of my favorite dish and here at cheesecake it is the worst thing I ever had. The bread was too rough even the avocado spread on it could not make it soggy.<br><br>Tuscan Chicken - 3/5 <br>        It has very small pieces of chicken breast and the plate was covered in oil and lemon juice. Not at all tasty. It says it is a skinnilicious dish but I can see hell lot of calories.<br><br>Overall the experience of cheesecake factory here in  the mall is very bad.

I love this chain, but the staff desperately needs training. Don&#39;t expect attentive or normal service.<br><br>50% of the time the server will take over 15-20 minutes to greet you upon seating, provide a menu and/or water or they don&#39;t come at all and you have to go get them <br>30% of the time the server will forget or mistake your drinks or order<br>5% of the time they serve you something rotten (check your fruit toppings or tartare)<br>5% of the time the server brings you the wrong dish<br>5% of the time you get billed incorrectly<br>5% of the time you get an above average server for this Cheesecake Factory, who actually provides normal service, because he/she probably received training at another restaurant before.

Honestly I know it&#39;s not trendy but this place  great every time. We come for dinner sometimes with the kids, very kid friendly. We come for the happy hour special also. It&#39;s always packed. The food is delicious, even the healthy items. The drinks are well done and the vibe is fun.

I think most people have gotten the starring right with this Cheesecake Factory .. it just doesn&#39;t match up to the others.<br><br>I mostly blame it on the inconsistency of the food.<br>The wait staff is also horrible.<br><br>I once sat for 15 minutes before I was waited on, and that was after I requested a waiter.

Finally convinced my bf to go here and it proved itself like I knew it would! The skinny margarita and pineapple Moscow mule-- both great though on the sweeter side. Mac and cheese balls and cheeseburger spring rolls -- both awesome, especially the spring rolls. Brussel sprout app we had as a dinner side -- fantastic. Arugula flat bread (I got without prosciutto) was delicious and the crust was soooo tasty. He got the crispy chicken with pasta dish, which got better with each bite. And lastly, the cheesecakes, which we got to go. I always get the Reese&#39;s one (loved it like always) and he got the cinnamon bun one which he was still sneaking bites of this morning. The only downside was that the cheesecakes were much smaller than I&#39;ve gotten in the past, though I haven&#39;t been here in a couple years. They used to be twice the size. This is probably for the best though...

Good place for good food. Portion are generous. Menu is extensive. So much to choose from. I had jambalaya which had shrimp and chicken. Its one of best dish at Cheesecake factory as in my humble opinion. By time I finish with that I would not find room to eat cheesecake. I really cannot remember last time I had a cheesecake there. Portion of food is so much, no room for anything else. I was looking at menu items and seems many items are over 2000+ calories. But this is the good place, if you want to have somewhat nice place to sit down and have good meal.

We got the chicken pot stickers, chicken samosas, salmon, beet and goat cheese salad, and the crispy chicken sandwich. Everything was good overall and the ambiance is what you expect from a Cheesecake Factory. We came in at around 7pm on a Tuesday and were seated promptly at a booth. During our meal I have to say the service was on the slow side. Drinks specially took quite a while to come out though water was refilled promptly. The chicken potstickers had a bit too much vinegar in the sauce but tasted ok. The chicken samosas were fine but tasted like they were missing something. Could definitely used more of a kick for my taste. The beet and goat cheese salad was probably the favorite dish of the night.<br><br>From the entrees, the salmon was just ok and the crispy chicken sandwich was just better than average. The fries were just ok.<br><br>I had a couple of old fashioned&#39;s with my meal and they were not bad. Better than what I expected.<br><br>We did not have dessert.

This is probably last time We will visit to Cheesecake Factory due to poor services we got there<br><br>When we went there wait time was 20 min OK  still we tolerated and sat for  35 min<br>When we got table  being vegetarian we asked for Veg Berger and beer<br>We were served beer with flat bread which were ordered <br>Then lady who took our orders came with information that do not have veg Berger&#39;s as they do not made today <br>As we have already started taking beer we were not able to go to next Berger bar<br>When we ordered vegi pasta and Soft tacos we were served very tasteless dishes with some boiled cauliflower without any dressing<br>On the top of this we were charged for Chiken Pasta and chiken Tacos<br><br>Bill no 0728<br>Table 33<br>19:54 on 21Dec2018<br><br>If you are vegetarian do not visit to this worst Factory at all and shell out hefty dollars for nothing<br><br>Add to this complementary bread with cheese was served along with main course as they said bread was in oven ????????<br><br>Hope they will improve <br><br>I just checked Chiken taco dish photo and then I realized they have really cheated us <br>No beans,no guacamole side of taco <br>Stuffing was just few leaves of lettuce no dressing

Ive ordered to go from here about 3 times. The firsr time i ordered chicken picatta, they left out the mushrooms. The second time i ordered the same thing, they gave me a smaller than usual portion of pasta. Tonight i ordered the farfalle with roasted garlic and chicken dish, one of my favorites. It doesnt taste anything as it should. I say this because i use to be employed at cheesecake factory at another location. The pasta looks like there is no sauce at all, and if there is any its butter sauce. There isnt one piece of roasted garlic in the pasta either. The meal is horrible. And a waste of $28. (I also ordered cheesecake but thats hard to mess up.)

This place is always packed! 30 minutes wait for a table for 2 on Saturday at 7:30pm. They hand out buzzers so you can shop around while waiting for the table.<br><br>Free bread: nice and warm! Whole wheat and white.<br><br>Chicken Madeira: chicken, melted cheese, asparagus and mushrooms in a wine sauce. Comes with mashed potatoes. It&#39;s pretty good, although I felt the wine sauce was a little too sweet.<br><br>Louisiana style chicken and pasta: Parmesan crusted chicken over bow tie pasta. The chicken was super crispy and great, but the pasta was bland. This dish showed up as the #1 dish to order in Cheesecake Factory in my research. I was surprised when it didn&#39;t turn out as good. <br><br>Tiramisu cheesecake: when tiramisu and cheesecake married and had a child, this is it. Coffee-soaked lady finger bottoms, mascarpone-cheesecake filling and topped with a layer of chocolate powdered mascarpone cream. My only small complaint is the chocolate cream swirl is too sweet (you can remove it if u want - it&#39;s not mixed into the cake).<br><br>Our 2 entrees could probably feed 3. We brought home leftovers. Our bill was $46. They are running a promo now where if you purchase a $25 gift card, you get a free slice of cake.

We ordered the Loaded Baked Potato Tots and the Spicy Chicken Chipotle Pasta, but only received our appetizer. Our waitress came by twice, to take our orders and to check up on us. It has been almost an hour and we didn&#39;t receive our entree, she told us it was on the way. After a while of waiting, another waitress noticed me looking for our waitress. She gave us some water and said she will check up on our pasta. We waited. It still didn&#39;t come so we just decided to just call for the check because it&#39;s ridiculous, we only ordered 2 items and even asked for them to be brought out together. The place wasn&#39;t even that packed and I would be more appreciative if our server gave us an explanation at the very least. The manager came and told us we didn&#39;t have to pay and was allowed to leave. I guess that was because we only received our appetizer. <br><br>The food there isn&#39;t bad, but the service tonight was horrible.

This restaurant is always busy. As soon we came in we asked for a table for two the hostess didn&#39;t even answer me. Then, when I asked how long is going to take he looked at me in a way I didn&#39;t like it. I don&#39;t blame on them but if you&#39;re working with public you should be kind at least! Speaking of food, it was ok. The waitress wasn&#39;t paying attention to us. She didn&#39;t ask us if we wanted to refill our soda or bread As they always do. In general, poor service!
Called in ordered for pickup, Angel hair pasta with shrimp. This is what got for $19.50. It&#39;s so nasty and only four shrimp, disgusted. <br><br>FOUR shrimp really!! So disappointing never again!

It was a party of 15 and we called in advance to let the hostess know that we were on our way. When we arrived, they were no longer able to sit us together that we had to wait 2 hours. We were all waiting to eat, starving I should say and then for someone to tell us that we had to wait 2 hours just to sit. That was horrible. It worked out though, we managed to sit in 3 different tables right next to each other and the waitress, Britney was AMAZING! She worked very hard to make sure we all received what we asked for. Her communication with us was on point and her great attitude made this experience good. The food was too salty for some of the family but the pasta was great for others. I guess it&#39;s just this location. We shall see.

Service is always great here. I had lunch on Friday here with my friend, the strawberry lemon aid is AMAZING! the wings fries and max and cheese! Amazing for 2 people it felt like a little bit of food, until we began eating it, and we couldn&#39;t finish it all! I took a chocolate mousse to go. Not my fave, like the red velvet! But I was in a mood to try something new. Will be back again, since your located in the mall and the staff is always friendly! See you soon CheeseCake Factory

The Cheesecake Factory is high class chain restaurant that has many options to eat.  It has a wide variety of food that is prepared and presented very well.  I have been to many locations and this one in Newport mall is a smaller one but the good is still very good.  The workers there are very friendly and helpful. <br><br>The ambiance is like its other locations, very cozy and intimate.  It does get crowded and you might be waiting some time for a table during peek dining hours.  <br><br>The food is flavorful a little on the pricey side but it&#39;s a better option then most chain restaurants if u don&#39;t feel like cooking.  Don&#39;t forget to grab yourself a slice of cheesecake heaven.  I don&#39;t even like cheesecake or sweets like that but I tried a slice of the salted caramel cheesecake.  WOW!!!! It put me in another atmosphere the lady next to me was laughing Bc my eyes were rolling to the back of my head....yes that feeling!!! Lol.
Food is good. No delays in order. Salmon is well cooked and everyone in the team enjoyed the lunch.

Not the best one I been so far,  it takes forever to bring the food and when the food came was cold. The waiter bring our drinks and didn&#39;t put the straws I have to ask for it. The cheesecake that I order taste like butter I wonder if they change the recipe or just on this restaurant.

Idk what is with these negative reviews?! We had the best early dinner (5pm) tonight, the happy hour is great and service couldn&#39;t have been better at the high top tables. The nachos were huge and so delicious and the crab dip was excellent as well. Both were 1/2 off- how can you be upset about that? Also the brown bread to start is seriously the best, I actually would buy a loaf. We also got a small Greek salad which was more of a chopped salad than an actual salad- it had olives, feta, cucumbers, red onion and some lettuce. It was fresh and the perfect side addition. We seriously had such a good dinner- we will be back!
The service is good and the free black bread is excellent. We asked for two more bread and more butter. I love this restaurant and have been to twice

I know this is a chain, and therefore I expect it to be like the others I&#39;ve tried. The smell of the restaurant was unpleasant walking in, so my expectations were low. Our server was amazing, she made helpful suggestions. The food was actually pretty good. I enjoyed 2 mojitos, very refreshing! The cheesecakes were perfection! For mall food, overall, I was pleased.

They served us meat despite telling the server we&#39;re vegetarians!!!!<br><br>This place has been my go to place after any movie I watch in the AMC theatre nearby. So yesterday this very kind server &#39;Jonathan&#39; asked for our order and me and my husband politely told him we&#39;re vegetarians and wouldn&#39;t prefer meat. We ordered tomato basil pasta. Despite telling him we&#39;re vegetarians, he brought us chicken pasta and we accidentally ate it. So after a bite or two, I had my suspicions and called up my server and asked him if this was chicken. Now, I don&#39;t mean to sound obscene but the balls on him, he was so cool about it and answered with a nod and a very unpleasant attitude! So rude! He didn&#39;t have the basic courtesy to apologise. That disgusted me even more. I pushed the plate away and walked out of the place while my husband paid the bill. Never coming back here again!<br><br>It&#39;s not cool to toy with people&#39;s believes. Serving meat to a vegetarian and disrespecting your customer is the worst thing you can do while running a restaurant. Such a bad experience.

Being my first time at a Cheesecake Factory, I will say it was not what I expected in a good way! I thought it&#39;d be like a Five Guys or something like that. Dimly lot and a nice romantic ambience. Host was kinda blah, he had the personality of a rock. He first sat us at a table where we&#39;d be sitting across from each other and I like to be close to my man so I asked for a booth.<br><br>We got a booth and waited....and waited for about 10 minutes. Pretty sure Jon Taffer says a patron should be first approached within 5 minutes. Plenty of waitstaff walked by with their noses in the air. My boyfriend got a manager and then we got served. Our waiter apologized and said we were seated in a closed area (I mean I didn&#39;t see any yellow tape). He was nice and got our order correct and prompt.<br><br>Anyway, the food was great! Crab bite appetizers were  delish and Mexican salad off the &#34;Skinnylicious&#34; menu was humongous. Bloody Mary&#39;s were free and delivered with an apology from the manager which was very nice. Aaannnd I got a free piece of cheesecake to go out of it!! So I only gave 3 stars because the waitstaff didn&#39;t seem very friendly in general, not smiling.

I ordered cheese cake through doordash. The restaurant charged me for hot fudge which they did not give me ! And when I called them they refused to accept it and tried to argue for no reason at all! I would not ever recommend ordering from here! They will charge you and not give you the item you pay for topping it with terrible customer service

A conveniently located branch at the newport mall. Consistency of the food quality is what I liked there. Chicken Madeira was good and so were the nuggests etc. <br><br>Server took forever to come to our table. In fact we had to wait for 30 minutes and had to ask twice for someone to actually come to us. <br><br>One server said that he will send someone and he never did. Another nice server lady was passing by and we had to stop her to actually take her order. <br><br>Chris&#39; outrageous cheesecake wasnt so good as well.

I came to The Cheesecake Factory for dinner on a Saturday. Arrived early enough and was able to be seated right away. There is so many options to chose from, to order at this restaurant. Which is a plus to me. I was with my family, so we started with the egg roll sampler, so we could all try the 4 different options offered.  This was a great choice, as not only were their 4 different kinds of eggrolls, but their was 4 different dipping sauces as well.  The sauces made them all better imo.  For my main meal, I went with the smokehouse bbq burger.   The burger was cooked medium, just as I requested, and was very flavorful.   Others ordered the chicken madeira, chicken piccata and mushroom burger.  No complaints and everyone enjoyed their meals.  I tried some of the chicken dishes and also gave them a thumbs up for taste.  Of course we couldnt leave without having a cheesecake.  We split the very cherry chocolate and reeses peanut butter one.  The cheesecake was the best part.  A very nice portion of cake is given for the price, and so rich in flavors.  I will be coming back to try many more cheesecake flavors and other meals here.  I had a great experience!

If I could give this place negative stars, I would. I just came here after a 14 hour shift at work to celebrate a holiday with my family, and I&#39;ve never been this disrespected at a restaurant before. The host was unbelievably rude. Even though the restaurant was not busy (Tuesday evening 8:30pm), they took their time to seat us. Then, after finally being seated, we did not get a waiter to even acknowledge us for over 20 minutes. When I politely went back to the host to let him know, he responded with a very curt and loud &#34;ok.&#34; A few minutes later, he proceeded to speak to who probably was supposed to be our waitress. They both stood there for some time, looked at our table and laughed. I thought the waitress was going to finally come to our table, but she walked right past us to talk to the customers next to us. <br><br>Needless to say, my family and I walked out and the host didn&#39;t so much as apologize. Thanks for ruining our holiday.

Um still sitting and waiting for a server after 15 mins of trying to get someone&#39;s attention. Only got service after we called over the matre-d <br><br>Okay so after we got a server, things went more smoothly. Complimentary warm bread was provided. I ordered the Mac and cheese burger which I thoroughly enjoyed.

My friend recently moved to an apt building 5 minutes away from here and I will never miss out on an adventure to check out the Cheesecake Factory. We came here for lunch, and when dinner time came, despite not being hungry, we scrolled through Seamless for half an hour until we decided to order from the CF twice in one day. The food from this chain is alway decent but never exceeds expectations other than with its sheer portion size. The inaptly named Skinnylicious menu should just be the regular menu. Even the Superfoods section consists of dishes well over 1k calories. Flavorwise, both the vegan cobb and the salmon salad are tasty, and so is the free bread. My bf&#39;s buffalo cauliflower also smelled amazing. Service is generally slow for both dine-in and take-out.
I like this place, too many options on the menu so I land up trying new items everytime and never disappointed. I loveee their chocolate fudge and tiramisu cheesecakes!

I used to like this place but wow.. this was a waste of time and money. I&#39;m on diet, so when I have a cheat day this is one of the places I used to have my calorie overload. Food took forever to come out and boy when it did... YUCK . Burger overdone and fries were obviously reheated in the microwave.. my friend&#39;s food  was even worse. She ordered honey truffle chicken. What did she get? Some hard ass chicken fingers without the honey. Yep I&#39;ll save my calories for chik fil a .

So firstly I want to say that my server Jeffrey was awesome.   <br><br>I made a reservation for a party of 18 people (Daughters bday), the day before.  We where seated, as mentioned, Jeffrey was awesome, he took everyone&#39;s order, food came out accurately and within a decent wait time.   So here&#39;s the time for desert.  Clearly, since I&#39;m covering the cost, I would not be purchasing single cheesecake slices @ $7.50 -$9.00 each.  I ask Jeffrey if I could purchase a whole cheesecake.  He said yes, I asked if it could be a quarter of different flavors and he mentioned that he would have to confirm with management and let me know.  A few minutes later, the manager walks over and states that all of their cheesecakes are frozen solid and not dethawed. So I think...WTF, this is Cheesecake Factory...how don&#39;t you have whole cheesecakes for sale. So I then ask her if they would be willing to accommodate us and get whatever number of slices to make a whole cake.  I have to say, I wanted to curse her out.  Firstly, she was very rude and condescending.  Secondly, she was unable to work with us even after I was trying to offer suggestions, and thirdly she was an absolute ditz that only kept repeating &#34;it&#39;s company policy&#34;.  I made a freaking reservation and they were not prepared.  WTF.  I wrote her name down, but lost the paper.  She was the manager that was there on Tuesday 7/16/19 @ approximately 8:30 pm.   We ended up buying one piece for my daughter so we could at least put the candles on and sing happy bday.   <br><br>I work right on Washington Blvd and best believed that I will no longer bring any of my team or colleagues there for a quick team outing or lunch.   <br><br>The only reason I gave it 2 stars was for Jeffrey.  Otherwise I would&#39;ve rated it at 1/2 a star.

I&#39;ve never been here before but heard great things about it. So I decided to take my fiancé here for date night. The wait for two people wasn&#39;t bad about 20 minutes. The mall had seats outside the restaurant playing Christmas movies on the tv. I personally don&#39;t like how close the tables are together preferred a little more privacy. I wasn&#39;t to crazy about what I ordered the black beans had no flavor what&#39;s so ever and the &#34;Jamaican&#34;<br>Chicken was nasty. If it&#39;s going to be Jamaican it should have a little spice in it. He ordered pasta that he really like. The red velvet cheesecake was amazing as it should be since it&#39;s there specialty. Waiter should listen more when taking an order as well as repeat it back to make sure it&#39;s what you ordered. I&#39;m willing to give this place one more try.

Was at the mall and decided to stop in and try their lunch menu.  Thankfully there was no wait time, since it was pretty early and we were able to get seated quickly.  We scanned the lunch menu, decided to have a few appetizers/small plates to share and were very happy with our choices as some of the apps were a bigger portion than others.  <br><br>Overall the space is big, the décor is bright, clean and modern.  The wait staff was on point and very helpful with questions and accommodations.

Shared some appetizers - avocado egg rolls, fried shrimp, and chicken samosas. Generally speaking they were pretty good.<br><br>For entrees the portion size is ridiculous - if you had appetizers and want to save room for dessert, there&#39;s no way to finish a pasta dish without having some left over. I had the Louisiana chicken pasta, which was very tasty but a little bit on the oily side.<br><br>For dessert we shared a selection of cheesecakes. True to its name, the Cheesecake Factory does make pretty good cheesecakes.

I have been here several times-mostly sitting at the bar (after and during shopping at the mall)and the service is always just acceptable. No warm greetings, no pleasantries, no smiles ever. Maybe the staff here hate their jobs. At least at Zinburger a few feet away, the bartenders and management make an effort to remember you. What&#39;s worse-at no time after my drink going empty have I EVER been offered a second drink...any of the times I&#39;ve been there. Is this the only place in the world the bar and the bartenders don&#39;t need your money?! I always tip generously regardless, but I always leave with a bad taste in my mouth.

Food is great but the service SUCKS. After sitting at our table for 20+ mins, receiving our kids meal and app, we had to ask our waiter for our waters and complimentary bread.<br>Now, we&#39;ve been here for about 45 mins and we&#39;re still waiting on our entrees while the table around us have been served (yes, they got here after us). I&#39;m at the point where im not even hungry anymore and i just want to grab the check and go. It&#39;s even worse that the waitress for the table next to us keeps checking in on them and the food they already received, while we have to flag down our waiter.

I don&#39;t wanna sound like I&#39;m overrating this place but you got to give it up for consistency. Rarely have I been to any of these chains and been disappointed. Lately I mainly die for happy hour which is the best deal around. They have the best apps in general and during HH you get them for 5-6$. Long Island iced teas are the same and I can get nice and toasted with good food for cheap prices. I recently had the short rib sliders which were bomb for the price. And you can&#39;t go wrong with avocado egg rolls either. Overall the value for happy hour specifically is why I gave it a higher rating. 3.8/5

First time ever trying the Cheesecake Factory last night!  My girlfriend and I were very impressed.  We went in knowing that&#39;s it&#39;s a chain and honestly didn&#39;t know what to expect.  Had to wait maybe 10 mins and then we were seated.  The restaurant is pretty dark with dim lighting and decorations which were relaxing. When first looking at the menu, you&#39;re immediately overwhelmed by the amount of options and different types of food (American, Asian, Mexican, Italian, Southern, etc).  There&#39;s literally a choice for everyone.  Even though it took us a good half hour just to decide what to eat, we made some good choices with the help of our server and we were not disappointed!  The food was delicious and the portions were enormous!  Topped off the dinner with a slice of their famous original cheesecake and I have to say it may have been the best cheesecake I&#39;ve ever had.  Great experience, not too expensive, and we&#39;ll be coming back.

Cheesecake Factory is a no brainer establishment...why? because you know exactly what you&#39;re going to get! Good food! Oddly enough whenever I&#39;ve gone to the Cheesecake Factory I never order cheesecake as my dessert...I haven&#39;t figured out yet why that always happens.<br><br>Well anyway I ordered simple food today...crab bites, bang bang shrimp, Chinese chicken salad and Passionfruit Mojito.<br><br>Let me get right to the point and close this post. Crab Bites Salad and Mojito and even the table wheat bread...I LOVE !!!!....but, those Shrimp were tasteless bland...blah blah blah I sent em back and got another order of the Crab Bites instead...then I was happy. <br><br>I also love how the Newport Mall now has made steps to improve the eateries and slowly the quality of shops...okay I&#39;m done with this post..G&#39;night!

Had to get something at the mall.  Noticed this place was nearly empty.  I decide to go in anyway.  The host (highschool kid)  starts giving me a story.  I put my hand up and stop him mid nonsense and walk out.  I&#39;ve been to many of these and never saw one so empty.  There must be a reason.

I really wanted to like this place because I am a fan of their cheesecakes from other locations. However, the caramel macadamia nut cheesecake, which I took to go, left a bad taste in my mouth. I wasn&#39;t able to have more than one bite. It seemed the nuts went bad somehow.

I know too many words! <br><br>When I came to Yelp to show my cousin pictures of the food I didn&#39;t understand the 3 stars overall rating. This is my 4th or 5th time here and today may be my last! When I arrived with my cousin and our two 7 year olds we were seated on the &#34;patio&#34; at the outside corner table as soon as you walk through the doors, very visible. <br><br>Per our usual we ordered the kids&#39; meals first. I ordered the salmon for mine and realized that our server never asked what kind of veggies she wanted. We could see her putting the order in so I ran all the way to the other end to update her. Whew! We would&#39;ve ended up with carrots and mashed potatoes, but the waiter changed it to fries and broccoli and I watched her do so. <br><br>When she came back to our table she informed us that they ran out of broccoli, leaving both of our girls disappointed. My mini-me does not eat all veggies unless they are cooked a certain way so I knew any other offering would be a problem. So I asked for a small caeser salad with no cheese and we put in our app order. After the girl&#39;s got their food sans the salad, the waiter said her manager was insisting on charging for the salad substitution. Really?!?! So I asked to speak to this hooligan. Smh 15 minutes later and no manager, no salad, then the waiter said she&#39;d bring one and eventually she did. We put our main order in after we received our apps and waited a good 25-30 minutes for the entrees. I wish I would&#39;ve taken a picture, but my meal looked like my 1st grader plated it. I ordered the Shrimp with Angel Hair with a spaghetti substitution. Boo for me because I was given angel hair which to me might as well be real hair! I was still willing to eat it as long as the flavor of garlic, herbs, and basil was there as promised, but sadly no. The pasta was bland and literally tasted like tomato sauce right out of a can. The &#34;sautéed&#34; shrimp, which were bone dry and placed around the plate like the numbers on a clock were also lacking seasoning. They were so white, dry and flavorless that I&#39;m having a difficult time calling them shrimp and definitely NOT SAUTÉED shrimp. For two seconds I thought about taking it home and fixing it, but reality struck that there was no amount of garlic or salt and pepper to fix this $20 meal. <br><br>I informed the waiter that I couldn&#39;t eat it because the pasta was wrong and it lacked everything promised in the menu. I also informed her that they brought out mashed potatoes and not the french fries (luckily mini-me eat the mashed ones) as requested and that overall this was a bad experience for me. I did order cheesecake to go and told her I guess that would be my dinner. <br><br>The manager never came and checked on us even after returning my meal. No one ever offered to make this right. We still tipped the waiter even though she could&#39;ve been way more attentive, but she did the best she could in dealing with the situation with no support from her manager. <br><br>If I return I will stick with the miso salmon I recommended to my cousin which was good and the tuna dishes which are also always very consistent. Who cooked my nasty shrimp pasta??? Please send them back to first grade.

Great start to our visit - being told there was a 20 minute wait! Yes, il take that! My husband was flying out of Newark so we decided to have a meal at Cheesecake Factory beforehand. We were worried we wouldn&#39;t be able to fit it in, but were pleasantly surprised at the wait time, especially compared to other Cheesecake Factory restaurants that we have been to. We grabbed our drinks at the bar and soon after we were seated. <br><br>My husband had the grilled chicken tostada salad and I had the Kobe burger. The portions were huge, so we didn&#39;t make it to the cheesecake, but we really enjoyed our meals. My burger had great flavor and was really juicy and I loved the fries!! They were so good. Everything on the salad looked so colorful and fresh. We were very full and didn&#39;t even manage to finish! I&#39;m already planning my return already!

The wait was not terrible and the staff was extremely friendly. The food was pretty<br>Good but not amazing and it&#39;s expected but we have always had a great meal the few times we have gone. The pink lemonade drink was not my style but sounded good so I ordered it<br>And the waitress was kind enough to switch<br>It out for a glass of wine it was just very sweet. The loaded potato ball things were so good as well as the flat bread pizza. Dinner my husband absolutely didn&#39;t enjoy his but they changed it out and he got a new dish (to go) by the time he got it. Mine and the kids were just fine. I got 2 cheesecakes to go and just had some today and a piece of paper or something was inside of it so I am not happy about that but not much I can do being it was to go and 2 days later. Overall place was good because of the staff and the food was as expected and somethings tasted great and some not so much.

Food is great, but I have to stop dine in this particular location. Because the smell of cleansing product from tables and floor is too strong!!! I&#39;m not sure if the employees there notice it anymore, but it is unbearable for me to have lunch at a place that smells like bathroom. Do something please. I really love you guys but can&#39;t have food there. Your waiting staff needs tip money as well. Please don&#39;t let me order takeout anymore.
The restaurant has a mouse problem. We saw one under the table. Server told us they don&#39;t know what to about the mouse problem and that the mice are friendly.

Looking for a nice ambience but reasonable food? This is the place for you. <br>About food: it&#39;s so delicious. I had chicken samosas and dynamite shrimp in appetizers. Perfect quantity , so soft to eat and delicious. <br>Shrimp pasta for main course! Enough for 2 people to share and equally tasty.<br>Dessert: the cheese cake! Obviously! It has to be good but this delicious?
This is was my first time coming here and I wasn&#39;t dissapointed. Everything from the bread, to the pasta to the cosmopolitan to the cheesecake was great. The service was great as well.

This was the first time I had to tell a restaurant HOW to make something on their menu. <br>I ordered a Chicken Bellagio, which is spaghetti tossed in pesto with chicken, arugula, and prosciutto, and I was presented with chicken and prosciutto on a bed of naked pasta (pictures shown below). <br>When I told the waitress my meal wasn&#39;t what I ordered, she gave me a confused look and asked what was missing. After telling her the kitchen forgot the sauce and arugula, she came back with a bowl of arugula and walked away. I was still missing my sauce so I asked the waitress to come back and she brought my plate back to the kitchen and asked &#34;what is the sauce supposed to be?&#34; Pesto, I answered. And she came back with my pasta.... covered in olive oil and pepper.<br>Along with everything else, the overall service of this place is sub-par. Take it that I should not be expecting much from chain restaurants, but this place has pretty bad service. We waited 20mins even though there were tables open (I actually pointed out a clean empty table to my party when we first came in and we were seated there 20mins later). There was also a fiasco with a customer who accused the hostess of calling her then N-word... but that died down after 10 mins or so.

Horrible service here. We came in without reservation on a Saturday yeah the wait i knew would be long but they said 50 min wait but if someone got up from a high table top near bar we can take it so we quickly took one and sat down by 9:00 pm they only put 2 waitresses in this whole section and they keep disappearing for a while and so far 3 different tables picked up and moved somewhere else. It is now 9:53 and we are still waiting for our food to come out and never once was asked how we are doing. It isn&#39;t even that busy with people right now tables are empty and noone at the door to be seated there is no excuse for this stay away due to service.

Visited from Maryland me and my daughter went to the Cheesecake Factory the worst food experience. I ordered the Louisiana Parmesan Chicken pasta uncooked and chicken over cooked HORRIBLE!!!! Will never go back!!!

Why is everything so sweet there!!!!! Right from tacos to burgers to pastas, everything is sweet! Go there for the flat bread and the Tex Mex egg rolls. Its just a confusing menu with tasteless dishes.

Food is ok. It&#39;s Cheesecake Factory. It&#39;s like a fancy diner. Service is fine.  Everything is ok if you can get past the smell. This restaurant smells dirty. Like really ripe sour milk. They need to fire whoever cleans this place.  And when you ask the hosts or waiters about the smell they pretend like there is no smell. No smell? They should be fired too for lying or having nonfunctioning olfactory systems.

I&#39;m giving Cheesecake Factory 3 stars not because I think it&#39;s a great place overall but it is one of the better ones when compared to other CF locations. The wait is a bit long but the service here is much better than other locations.<br><br>The food is pretty much the same as other CF locations but they do pay better attention to detail when it comes to special requests. The variety of cheesecake compared to other locations is a bit lacking.

Roommates and I decided to treat ourselves with cheesecake after a day of studying. Why not The Cheesecake Factory? Little did I know that they are very slow and the customer service was awful. I gave the benefit of the doubt because it could be a busy night at The Cheesecake Factory. My patience runs out when it take over an 1.5 hours to cut three slices of cheesecake, which might already be cut, and pack it to give it to the delivery person. Maybe because it was doordash, but at least the driver picked up the phone. The hostess was good, but couldn&#39;t really help me. I was on the phone for 12 min waiting for someone at the bakery to pick up because I was concerned that the ice cream might have been melted. Guess what, no one picked up. I would understand if the kitchen was backed up, but I know the cheesecake is in a separate area of the restaurant. Good thing I go to Newport Mall a lot, so I can avoid this place because this ruined my night.

I&#39;ve been to Cheesecake Factory several times in last 2 years but the best food I had was in one of my most recent visits. Here is what we ordered from the never ending menu :<br>1. Guac and chips - Rating - 8/10<br>2. Spicy chipotle veggie pasta - out of this world amazinggg 100000/10<br>3. Veggie flatbread - 7/10<br>4. Cucumber lemonade - too sweet - 5/10<br>5. Coffee cheesecake - 10/10<br><br>I&#39;ll highly recommend the spicy chipotle veggie pasta if you are a vegetarian like me and loves spicy food. <br><br>Ambience is always good at any cheesecake but I&#39;m taking a star off for the slow service.

This Cheesecake Factory is very average, wouldn&#39;t say amazing and wouldn&#39;t say bad. I got the Pasta Carbonara (non-lunch menu) and it was decently sized. It was flavorful, leaning on the a bit too creamy flavorful, and otherwise pretty standard. <br><br>It was very average, and exactly what I expected.
Serena W. was excellent food was great. Best dinning experience in a while. Will come back soon.

cheesecake factory now have impossible burgers !!!<br>typical cheesecake factory experience which is not bad at all.<br>quick seating, enough space, good service, decent food and big portions and breads (one of the best part of cheesecake factory)

I came here for my birthday today, and the service was horrible. The waitress did not take our orders properly. They gave my mother a drink with ice when she told them &#34;no ice&#34; due to her sensitive teeth. They also got our dinner orders wrong and did not serve my mother her meal. When I had my meal, the food was not cooked well, and the vegetables were hard. I could not finish my meal so I gave my mother my meal because she didn&#39;t have a meal of her own. The waitress was not attentive to detail at all and did not honor a coupon we brought in. We left without giving a tip because the service was zero stars if I could zero stars.

The management&#39;s responses on Yelp is not acceptable and the manager is unreachable via phone. If they are sincere about making things right, they should be the one calling me. For this experience, I haven&#39;t been going back here and never will.

I could give 0 stars if given a chance, i was waiting got 30 mins and no one came took my order and at last they came i ordered and i waited for another 30.mins and no food either and they didn&#39;t even check on me. I had to pay 4$ for coke. Already late for work so no.lunch, thanks to cheese cake factory.<br><br>I normally never review and actually this is my first review . I don&#39;t think I would ever go this restaurant given a chance

Came here on a Monday evening after a movie and there was no wait. Food and service was great. The steak and salmon dishes were simply grilled and reminded of a home cooked meal. The Kale Quinoa salad was pretty awesome. The vinaigrette was perfect. Save room for Cheesecake which is always good

Always room for improvement, so 4/5. We were happy overall.<br><br>Pros - <br>Great menu selections AND desserts.<br>Good portion sizes.<br>Quality ingredients.<br>Great taste and temperature of food.<br>Service timing good.<br>Server knowledgeable and helpful.<br>Server handled our requests professionally.<br>Other servers brought us drinks/food and were equally pleasant.<br>Server gladly wrapped up what we couldn&#39;t finish to go.<br>Restaurant was attractive and appeared clean.<br><br>Cons - <br>Men&#39;s room floor was very wet. I&#39;m guessing because they don&#39;t use hand towels, guest just shake their wet hands on the marble floor. I seriously almost fell when I entered the restroom, but grabbed onto the door handle and counter top for balance. I spoke with a manager and he was kind to say that he&#39;d take care of it right away.<br>Server seems rushed. He didn&#39;t rush us, but he seemed stressed in general.<br>Cocktails overly sweet, had to send one back.<br>Bread didn&#39;t seem fresh.<br>No silverware on the table before appetizers arrived, but server noticed and had them delivered quickly, unfortunately they were just dropped on the center of the table.<br>No manager checked on us.<br>I could hear other servers, not ours, cracking gum. Is that professional when working?<br>Bakery check-out was confused. No line and although several workers, only one at the register. I almost walked out without getting cheesecake!<br>To-go container was closed, but leaked sauce in the bag. Quite a mess when we got home.<br><br>As mentioned, we were all happy and didn&#39;t expect perfection. We will be back, again and again.

The service wasn&#39;t the best very sub-par. For example our server didn&#39;t think we needed a full set of utensils and when we asked we got 1 knife from a random table from a random staff person who I had to flag down. He seemed annoyed and I could relate. Drinks came out quickly which helped with my sense of annoyance but a server not serving and then ghosting us kind of...sucked.

Who doesn&#39;t love cheesecake from the cheesecake factory? This location is open past midnight, has a lovely &amp; familiar ambiance and of course has an amazing selection of cheesecake. The rest of the food can use a little bit of work (ahem) but late night cheesecake in a nice restaurant makes this superbly worth it :)
its awesome..always consistent Great food, service is irrelevant.  Its a chain and doesnt force me to wear good clothes like the next door Ruth Chris did.

Service was very friendly.  The food was good &amp; the environment was clean!  Portions are a bit smaller than other Cheesecake Factory.  I ordered garlic shrimp over angel hair as usually, this place only give you a small pasta serving. Only thing I can complain about is my waitress keep forgetting my drinks &amp; milk for my coffee.  You really have to have patient to dine here.

Surprised to see a 3/5 for this joint...but it was also my first time here. My friends and I came from NYC just to eat here. I was blown away; never have I given chain restaurants any credit, in fact, it has always been one disappointment after another. But the incredibly high number of calories of each drink, entree, and dessert on this menu only made me want more. I don&#39;t really remember the names of the plates we got, but I was surprised to see them range from pasta to Thai to good ol&#39; American. I loved my shrimp pasta and got a good kick out of my friend&#39;s spicy Thai chicken (actually don&#39;t even know if it&#39;s called that).<br><br>So the lesson is: don&#39;t be alarmed that you&#39;ll go over your calorie intake in less than 45 minutes and don&#39;t let the 1000 items on the menu dissuade you from ordering too much :) Better advice: don&#39;t wear skinny jeans to this meal.<br><br>Oh, and the cheesecake IS amazing. Touché.

I am actually rating Cheesecake Factory in Willowbrook mall. The customer service was superb. Went there to celebrate my brother&#39;s graduation and accidentally left my professional camera. Only realized it an hour after I got home and they saved it there for me until the next day. So appreciative!!! Tomato Basil Pasta is always great, but it is a huge portion. My husband is Dominican and he loved the Dolce de Leche cheesecake. I loved the caramel royale macchiato.....pretty sweet!

The ceaser salad dressing was too garlicky for my liking. The chicken in the pot pie was so juicy and the creamy sauce was rich and tasty. The fettuccine was on point and we had Chris outrageous cheesecake to go.

No longer do you have to travel to Wayne, NJ for the Cheesecake Factory, here is one in JC. <br>I like to visit restaurants a few times before reviewing (depending on experience). First off, I never have any issues with the staff, they are all friendly and attentive. <br><br>The food has been pretty good so far with my personal favorite being the southern chicken sliders. They offer a few lemonade mixes but all seem to be a little to sweet. <br><br>Most recent visit, they have added a few more items to their menu and the kids menu has plenty of different options. My son ordered salmon, broccoli, and French fries which looked and tasted awesome. So far they are holding their own in my book.

Took an hour and a half long trip to this Cheesecake Factory after calling and speaking to someone about birthday specials, specifically a complimentary slice since it&#39;s my birthday. The person who answered the phone assured me that I would be given a complimentary slice. This was enough for me to take the trip because who doesn&#39;t want all of the bday trinkets. One star lost because an hour an a half travel later, after being seated, my waitress told me that they only offer a scoop of ice cream for birthdays, which would be fine had I not been given an another answer hours before. I did ask someone at the front and he checked with a manager and so it was true, my trip to the cheesecake factory for a birthday slice was a waste so there was that. I eventually took the ice cream scoop to go and they did try to jazz it up with sprinkles and chocolate sauce. I just would not have made the trip on this occasion to celebrate because it was a big disappointment, after all no one goes to the cheesecake factory for ice cream but I guess. I had the Chicken Bellagio for dinner and it was quite nice. The pasta was al dente, the chicken was perfectly fried and the arugula was tossed in a nice dressing! My biggest disappointment with the dish was the lack of flavor in the pasta. It was coated in a basil dressing or oil and on the sides of the plate was a cream sauce which was very well needed throughout the entire pasta part of the dish. Without it, the pasta was bland and just there. I didn&#39;t have time to make any suggestions or ask for more of the sauce but maybe on my next visit, whenever that may be since it is out of the way, I will do so. Service was attentive and right. The host even prepared a table for me and truly took her time to wipe it down. That is important because some people just dont care however 1 hour until closing she gave great effort. The service is 5 stars solid but the miscommunication between customer and staff via the phone and the lack of flavor in the main part of the dish brought it down. I would still suggest you visit if you&#39;d like just don&#39;t expect cheesecake from the cheesecake factory for your birthday even if you called ahead. Read yelp reviews instead.

We came over for brunch and we ordered traditional Benedicts, for huge fans of Benedicts on the brunch I must say those were the worst, I would never recommend to order it. Despite on that, I still love this place for for evening, homely atmosphere and for the service which is wasn&#39;t bad, but not excellent as well, we had to ask for bread to the dish it should be served with and we never got water on the table. <br><br>However, There is one appetizer I would come there for Sweet corn trample cakes. It&#39;s it just a gem hidden in the huge ocean of the restaurant&#39;s menu! You just gotta try it! <br><br>Interior: 5/5<br><br>Service: 3/5<br><br>Food: 3/5

I&#39;m very disappointed of this place knowing that they have OK food and desserts.<br>Service was very sloppy, which I understand if you are bored why even bother to come to work. Food took way too long to serve and it was just pasta and cold bu the way!  I really feel disgusted by the service and food. This is the reason I give 1 star and not even deserve it. You better off going to Panda.

Great Passion Fruit Mojito to celebrate my birthday!<br>Brunch took entirely too long to come!<br>Dirty utensils and drinking glasses.<br>I was going to purchase 3 slices of cheesecake, but left in a hurry out of sheer disappointment

Honestly, it is a decent American restaurant in the neighborhood. We go there almost every week. It is not the first time we experienced the extremely long waiting for the food.
