But this time is the most disappointed experience. The waiter placed the wrong order for us. Before they brought the wrong food, we already have waited for 40min. When he kept telling us, it was just 5min away. Then what happened after 5min was just another 5min. He kept saying that it was someone else ordered the wrong food and overrided his order. But he couldn&#39;t explain what happened. So don&#39;t go there if you don&#39;t have enough time to wait. <br>P.S. Another lady sitting next to our table experienced a similar situation.

This location was a lot busier than the others I usually go to, but they handle the crowd well. Our server did get several tables at once, so the service did get a little slow at one point. Aside from that this is what I&#39;ve come to expect in terms of quality from Cheesecake Factory!<br><br>One important thing to note is that parking is expensive here. Not that it&#39;s any fault of Cheesecake Factory, but still it is important to know.

Still a lot of waiting around. I almost wish there was a better timer to manage it - the bread and the delays in drinks didn&#39;t help.<br><br>Fried avocado/mushroom/zucchini appetizer came 20 minutes after my pasta...odd. I would&#39;ve canceled it had Antonella not been so nice about it.<br><br>The Pasta da Vinci is actually quite good - not nearly as salty and a very mild sauce with mushrooms and chicken balancing the penne. Better experience, though portions seem to have gotten smaller - the last time I had pasta here, it was 2x the meal.

I have another great experience here. I have been at this location before and I have always enjoy the food. This time we had the on trains from the skinny menu. Which is under 500 calories. Also a corn tortilla soup and my daughter just bbq wings. The service was great as well. Will be back! Thanks to my server Mohammad A

So today, April 2, 2018...I get a seemingly insincere apology from management in response to my experience. That apology is the same apology sent to other disappointed and frustrated patrons. I&#39;m not satisfied and I still will never return to that location. Obviously management is doing a poor job making good on promising better, as nothing has improved at this location.

Great Lunch today at the Cheesecake Factory. I orders a Pineapple Mojito and the Louisiana Chicken Pasta, recommended by our server Anthony and he was spot on by all his suggestions. Great Job Anthony!

Ordered to go food:<br><br>Food:  I ordered chicken lettuce wrap and beet goat cheese salad.  The food was okay.  I was disappointed with the lack of avocado in my lettuce wrap (see picture).  The flavors of the salad were pretty well balanced and adequate.  The goat cheese blended well w the beets.  3/5<br><br>Service:  they took my order really quickly but the pain was in the waiting time. It has been over 32 min for a simple to go order.  It is on Tuesday night at 9:38pm when I came in and it was slow for them. This is a bit ridiculous! Manager needs to pay attention to this kind service. With such a small simple order, it should never ever take this long especially for a professional chain restaurant.<br>1.5/5<br><br>Atmosphere: your typical chill cheese cake factory. It is a smaller location than others.  4/5
Just had lunch here. For the app I had chicken taquitos and entree Louisiana Chicken Pasta. Both very good. I highly recommended the pasta was delicious.

Food: The mushroom croquettes and herb crusted salmon were average. The Jamaican shrimp and chicken was a disaster. For a $20 entree, there are 3 small pieces of shrimp. The dish is described as &#34;very spicy&#34; on the menu, but tastes almost sweet with no hint of spice. The chicken taquitos were cold and tasteless with no hint of chicken in them. <br><br>Drinks: Absolutely watered down.<br><br>Service: The server (Dominique K) seemed disinterested, took a while to get the bread, forgot the straw and had to be asked 3 times to get us a box at the end. We saw staff at other tables being much more friendly and attentive to their patrons.<br><br>Overall: Will never repeat. The Newport Mall has so many better options<br><br>NOTE TO MANAGEMENT: It is misleading to calculate &#34;suggested gratuity&#34; on the after-tax receipt total. It is customary to calculate tips on the pre-tax number.

Overall, I really love everything about the Cheesecake Factory. They have amazing service, great food, and beautiful ambience.This is my go-to place at least 1 a week. Their portions are really big that it is fit for 2 people! <br>Whenever I go, I always order the fried cheese, avocado toast, and their chipotle pasta! I would rate them 5/5! However, the last time we went, not only did our waiter forget about our order for a half hour, we ordered their new dish called &#34;Korean style cauliflower&#34; and it came really cold and soggy. It is only good if it is hot and crispy. <br> <br>Always go during their happy hour on weekdays. Appetisers for about $5-$7! Amazing portion for such a great price!

I have to say, I&#39;ve visited a lot of Cheesecake Factory restaurants across America also in Hong Kong and this one has to be the worst service and dirty cutlery. Our waitress- Natalie was NOT attentive at all. Got the drinks wrong, never once checked on our table until I waved her down. Never gave us a bread basket and that&#39;s a first across all cheesecake factories. Normally I would get a cheesecake but I was so extremely disappointed with the service I wanted to leave ASAP. She went missing throughout our dinner. Food was fine, just the cutlery and cups were so dirty.

Today, National Cheesecake Day July 30, 2016 was a four star experience. From the time we entered the restaurant we were smiled at and greeted by friendly employees. My daughter asked for a booth for two. We were seated promptly near the kitchen area. Better to be closer to the food!!<br>We looked over the menu and made our decision. We were told out server would be with us soon. I assumed he was the server assisting a huge party of about twelve. Sure enough he came over introduced himself as Ty. So nice and knowledgeable about everything Cheesecake Factory. We were hungry and ready to order. He took our order making special note of my allergy to tomato. <br>In no time our food arrived looking absolutely delicious. We were chewing down and Ty gave us a check to see if we were fine. He was great with his timing and not a pest. He still kept up with that huge group that looked like they were having a ball!<br>Our dishes were removed when we were done and Ty promptly took our desert request. Again it was no time before I had my Vanilla Bean Cheesecake that I inhaled with no problem. My daughter took her Nutella Cheesecake to go. <br>Only two small problems. I won&#39;t take away stars because overall it was the best experience I&#39;ve had at this location. <br>First, my daughter didn&#39;t want whipped cream to go. She got it anyway. I couldn&#39;t get a decent photo. Her slice was a mess in the container before we left. It shouldn&#39;t change the taste. I&#39;ll get a report when she eats it. <br>Second, every time we&#39;ve been to eat at this location we have had something flying around our food. Once it was a fly. Today it was a little bug of some kind. I really wish they would fix that problem. I don&#39;t like to share my food!! Maybe N.J. doesn&#39;t have the strict rules we have in NYC. Didn&#39;t have this issue in Wayne or Hackensack though at their Cheesecake Factory. <br>Still Ty especially made this a great experience. Half price Cheesecake didn&#39;t hurt either. Transportation to get there and home added big cost to our meals!!

It&#39;s always a long wait to get your food, asked the server 3 times,if we could at least get bread, she came back upset and said there isn&#39;t any. Waited 15 mins for a server to show up and it&#39;s been 30 mins since we ordered our food and we are still waiting!

Came here for dinner one night with the boyfriend and we had a great time. The set up in JC is pretty big and the &#34;outdoor&#34; space is really nice. I say outdoor with quotes because you&#39;re still sitting inside of the mall, just outside of the restaurant. It was nice and relaxing how they have it set up.<br><br>Food here is always about quantity, but that&#39;s kinda why I like cheesecake factory. They give me a lot, though let me tell you, my stomach regrets it the next day. My go to here is the chicken bellagio, but their chicken sandwich and eggplant parm are my faves too. I usually get cheesecake too (tiramisu is my favorite), but this time, I opted for the apple strudel. It was pretty darn good! I wish they put more ice cream on it though to balance out the warm caramelized apples.<br><br>Overall, had a great time here and probably will be back!

Overall it wasn&#39;t bad or good. Seems like other Cheesecake Factory locations have better food, cleanliness and service. Some changes in personnel and proper training can go a long way at this location. Skip for now.

Well, it has probably been about 8 years since I&#39;ve dined at the Cheesecake Factory.  I generally stay away from chain restaurants but this was the most convenient food nearby and you can&#39;t really go wrong with The Cheesecake Factory.  The flavor is consistent and the menu is quite extensive to satisfy your taste for just about whatever you may want on a given day.<br><br>I had the Cobb Salad.  It was pretty good and for those who don&#39;t know, The Cheesecake Factory salads can normally feed 2 people easily.  A few other items were being passed around on the table like fried calamari and crab bites, both pretty good appetizers.  And who can forget about their warm bread, especially that pumpernickel loaf. Yum! The tropical-flavored house iced tea is always a welcomed refreshing treat to wash it all down.  I didn&#39;t taste the other items that my family order but all I heard was &#34;nom, nom, nom...&#34; as we all stuffed our hungry faces so that&#39;s always a good sign.  For dessert, we shared the banana cheesecake and the turtle cheesecake.  If you have ever had Cheesecake Factory cheesecake, you know that they don&#39;t play when it comes to the cheesecake in terms of the size of their menu and the flavor.  <br><br>I spent many an evening at The Cheesecake Factory when they first opened and began expanding beyond Atlanta all the way to the San Francisco Bay Area.  All in all, even though I don&#39;t visit often nowadays, the Cheesecake Factory still holds a special place in my heart for nostalgia&#39;s sake if nothing else and I was happy to find that the food was still what I expected and the martini menu is still on point!

Worst experience ever. We had a work lunch on a Friday at 1 o&#39;clock. We had called before to get a reservation, but were told they don&#39;t accept reservations after 1. Yet while we waited a group came in after us and said they had a reservation and were immediately seated. We had a substantial wait even though there was a large amount of open tables. It then took over an hour for our mediocre entrees to arrive. My burger was like a child&#39;s meal. What happened to the large portions Cheesecake Factory was known for? We asked for the check with our meals as we had to get back, and the waitress screwed that up too. Never again!!

Came by a few weeks ago with the girls after a movie. There was a wait, but its the cheesecake factory you know there will be a wait. Once seated, our waiter did a great job accommodating our group and or food came out fairly quick. I ordered a behemoth of a salad (chicken ranch I think) it came with fried onions, corn, avocado,beans, and it was awsome. I&#39;ll definitely order again

Came for brunch on a Sunday. We were promptly seated and they brought our bread right away. I ordered the chicken and waffle eggs Benedict and my mom got the brûléed French toast. <br><br>DO NOT EVER ORDER THE CHICKEN AND WAFFLES FRENCH EGGS BENEDICT. The hollandaise sauce was so thick and tastes congealed. It got all over everything and just grossed me out. I barely finished my meal, and even then I was scraping that sauce off of it. <br><br>My moms French toast was good. It was very thick and sweet, but pretty decent. Overpriced for only two slices but we did enjoy it. <br><br>I wouldn&#39;t go back for brunch.

We went during happy hour were very satisfied with what we ordered. They had a HH menu all cocktails and apps were 5.95 each and big portions. Cheesecakes were 7.95 a slice and they didn&#39;t add gratuity to our check unlike many places I&#39;ve been to. Place was packed during HH but the wait was only about 10 minutes. Everything we had was delicious. Long island iced tea, warm crab and artichoke dip, pork belly sliders, and avocado eggrolls.

Very disappointed with the service. <br>First, no body even asked us for water<br>Second: Appetizers and main course was served together (that too after 30 mins)<br>Third: Drinks were served towards the end of our meal.

Ive heard mix reviews about this location from their initial launch to some reviews on here already. Came by a few weeks ago with some of my favorite amigos and must say we left super full and satisfied. <br><br>We had about a 10 minute wait before being seated which was a little confusing because it was 2pm on a week day and it wasn&#39;t a full restaurant. We finally sat at a booth really enjoyed that you can look right into the kitchen as they are busy preparing peoples meals. We were greeted by our waiter who seemed nice. <br><br>We orders some apps and cocktails everything came out pretty good. We waiting a while for our food but at this point we really should have just stopped at apps because we were pretty full. <br><br>Service was okay nothing majorly great about it. I would definitely come back if I was in the mood for a chain restaurant. Its nice to know that is right at the mall so you know do not have to travel to other locations.

staying in the area for a NYC getaway.  visited one weekday night, 2 hours before closing (9pm).  hostess informed of a 20-min (at least) wait for tables (in JC!), so jumped to the free-for-grab bar table.  waitress was lukewarm all through, providing bare minimum.  we sat down for nearly 10 min and had to wave her down to get menus and bread, which was cold.  food and drinks were the average CF standard -- we were just eating for sustenance that night, so there was that. lucky this establishment is a &#34;been there, done that&#34; for us, so we didn&#39;t have high hope.  but the service still left a lot to be desired.

Never was one to go out of my way to write a negative review but the service here on a slow Monday night at 8pm was the worst I&#39;ve ever had. <br><br>My husband and I just wanted a quick bite, so we ordered two of the same burgers cooked the same way exact way. The only difference is I ordered sweet potato fries and he had regular fries. Easy enough right? Wrong. <br><br>Waited almost an hour for the two burgers. Meanwhile other customers that were seated after us got their food. We asked several times about our food and waitress kept saying it was on the way. <br><br>Finally our food comes I&#39;m guessing the manager on duty brings it out and there was no fries, and no bacon on the burger. So she had to go back to kitchen. That&#39;s just the first time. Second time brings the burgers but still the wrong order! No sweet potato fries. So she literally had to come back 3 times just to get our order right. <br><br>I didn&#39;t even mention when we sat down my utensils were dirty and asked for new ones and the waitress never replaced them. I&#39;m pregnant and starving I didn&#39;t even care at that point, I just wanted to finally eat, after a long hour+ of waiting. <br><br>Manager did offer us a piece of cheesecake and apologized but still reeling from the terrible customer service. I work in customer service it&#39;s just such a shame when you get terrible service back. I was so tired from the long day I just wanted to pay and leave. <br><br>But thinking back I should have remembered that manager&#39;s name so hopefully they can work on the terrible service here. I&#39;ve been to this location many times, the service and food used to be great. But now I would definitely think twice coming back.

This review is for both dine in and takeout. <br><br>My first experience here was dine in, my date and I were seated promptly, waitress was very helpful and well mannered. As an appetizer, we chose the Tex Mex egg rolls. I ordered the farfalle with pancetta, mushrooms, and chicken (minus the peas and carmelized onions that usually come with it). I also opted for spaghettini instead of farfalle and my waiter graciously accepted my alterations. My date went for the chicken alfredo. Both dishes came to us piping hot, beautifully presented and absolutely delicious. The Cheesecake Factory goodness that I fondly remember from years ago. Unfortunately my delivery experience was far from as pleasant as the dine in.<br><br>Last night, via DoorDash, my date and I went for TCF again. He went for the turkey burger with cheese and french fries on the side. I went for the same pasta, instead I got shrimp instead of chicken in it. The food came fairly cold, there were still onions in mine, the shrimp was tough and cold, and they didn&#39;t put any pancetta in even though I didn&#39;t ask for that to be removed. There was also no sauce in it. It seemed like they made the dish in a pan, drained the remaining sauce and let it sit and dry out for 30 minutes. My date&#39;s burger was a little cold but seemingly good, although the fries were no dice; soggy and cold. I know that I had a few alterations but I really can&#39;t see myself sending out a such a crappy dish like this, being in their place. Can&#39;t see myself ordering delivery from ever again. Not exactly fun spending almost $20 a mediocre, hardly edible dinner.

It was my first time at a Cheesecake Factory and obvious I thought they sell desserts only. But seriously that is only a reason to go to that place. <br><br>So many choices on the menu I couldn&#39;t make my mind, but thanks God they have &#34;combinations&#34; options. The crusted salmon with shrimp scampi was my choice and I don&#39;t regret. At all! <br><br>For dessert... Lemoncello cream torte. Jesus. The cake itself was a little bit too sweet for my taste, but the big fresh strawberries were there just to balance the sweetness and bitterness. Just as perfect as I am saying. <br><br>Thanks for this extraordinary experience I&#39;m leaving the city tomorrow... But thinking on when I will be coming back!

Hard to choose since so many items on the menu. Their pastas are great and salad too and everything!!! Now, you get to decide what cheesecake to order because why go to The Cheesecake Factory and not have a piece. No bad decisions here just the fact that this White Chocolate Caramel Macadamia Nut Cheesecake has 1560 calories per slice. I do admit that this is an excellent dessert!
Wide selection, adequate portion size, above-average taste, okay service, affordable price.

So I called in to place an order their phone was not working so I went over there to place it in person and it was complete madness. Very unorganized!!!!! They were receiving the orders and no one was calling out the names so people were there waiting for 40 minutes + <br><br>A manager has to jump in and take control and get the orders out after the amount of people waiting was immense. I ended up finally getting my order 45 minutes later and they forgot my cheese cakes!! So I had to go back and then when I got back to work 2 of the salads didn&#39;t have dressing. They need to get it together!!

I came with my friend on a Sunday night. Waited an hour to be seated, took them another hour for my entree to be served. Terrible experience. Not recommended. <br><br>Plus, my shrimp with angel hair is way too much.

First time EVER having cheesecake from here and it was amazing! I think this is the best place for cheesecake, really beats anywhere in BC, Canada.<br><br>Came here for take out got the Toasted Marshmallow Smores Gallore, was told it would take around 5 mins because they torch the marshmallow. No worries, even though we missed our Uber ride because of this, But it was worth it! The cheesecake was light, fluffy and almost melts in your mouth with gooey torched marshmallow anddd that whipping cream! <br> <br>Love, a Canadian Tourist really wanting to drive to states for this.

Went to Cheesecake and got served almost raw excessively al-dente pasta, the rigatoni barely gets cooked here. Got it changed and this time got served chicken in a vegetarian pasta. Discovered it when we got home. Called them, manager apologized and that&#39;s it. <br><br>Came back yesterday to give them another chance, got served chicken in a vegetarian pasta AGAIN. This time it happened to my friend who has been a vegetarian all her life for religious reasons. It is absolutely not acceptable. What if she was allergic? Would that make it a bigger deal for them? <br><br>Shut it down if you can&#39;t handle the rush. Shitty service is one thing, always serving us meat we don&#39;t eat is beyond my tolerance.
Food was okay, just very very salty.  The kitchen was also very slow.  Our server however, was very apologetic and he did a good job.

Everyone always talks about the Cheesecake Factory as if it is this great place so as soon as I seen it was now in Jersey City I made an effort to go. I had such high expectations for this place but sadly I was very disappointed. <br><br>Service: The wait time was an hour but since the restaurant was new it was understandable. But the wait time also made me expect more...and honestly it was not worth the wait. The waiter was nice and friendly but when I asked her if she could recommend something she said everything was good and they had lots of specialties....umm wrong answer ...sigh. The menu was so long I really wanted a recommendation. <br><br>Food: The Fried Macaroni appetizer was incredible. For my entree I ordered the chicken Marsala. When it arrived I noticed my pasta was extremely over cooked. I tried to eat it anyway but I just couldn&#39;t it tasted horrible so the waitress took it back and nicely removed it from the bill. <br><br>I doubt I will return here and am disappointed in my first cheesecake factory experience.
Saw two of the employees smoking outside with their apron on. Atleast take it off when you&#39;re on your break. I hope they washed their hands before going back to work.
I was at Cheesecake Factory last week. We ordered a ribeye steak over medium it was good and juicy. Highly recommend this place for my friends!

Came here with my boss and wife one night after leaving work across the street at Citi. We came here because it was close and &#34;reasonably priced&#34;. Do yourself a favor - keep on walking to whatever is next. Horrible service, cold food and waiting forever.<br><br>Don&#39;t really need to say more except apparently at this restaurant, attitude is commonplace.

Seriously the best experience I&#39;ve had here ever. Always loved this place so this review is overdue. Just had the chicken parmesan sandwich, like holy $#%T it was awesome. Our waiter Yival was 5 stars and my chocolate hazelnut cheesecake needs no introduction. If your thinking of going just GO....LOL <br><br>As always my reviews are based on experience and not just the food unless its terrible. Thank you!

This place has the most terrible customer service.  They always have a bunch of vacant seats but makes patrons wait nevertheless!  They do not take reservations and is extremely understaffed.  I will never return to this place again.  The wait is horribly long for no reason, the service is non-existent, and the food takes forever to arrive.

I&#39;m not one to usually give five stars to a chain... But so far I really like the food here. The Cheesecake Factory and general was where I first discovered a love for sliders. I love the table bread here and recently tried the Truffle bacon grilled cheese appetizer. It was sinfully good. My girlfriend and I shared a filet mignon medium and they let us substitute the mashed potatoes and beans for asparagus and grilled broccoli. The asparagus came at a small of charge though, but that was okay. We actually then order dessert and got Godiva brownie sundae- it was really good. I typically order from the skinnylicious menu, but was craving a protein other than chicken. The Fiji Waters were a bit expensive at about $ 4 a bottle. Also, we were sitting at the bar area with the stroller and the management was nice enough to lower the music a bit as it got very loud early on into our lunch.

First time coming to Cheesecake Factory! Great experience, service was great very attentive. Super friendly staff overall. The food looked good and tasted even better! Must try the cheesecakes! I got the Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough, and it was to die for! 10/10 would definitely come again!
I ordered the spaghetti carbonara with chicken. The food was okay, I&#39;d give it 3 stars. However, the customer service was excellent. Management was able to accommodate our party of 10 with ease.

Food was great! However, the table dirty floor dirty and the utensils sticky. Ladies room no toilet paper had to chase down a server who said she would be right back! <br><br>Waiting five minutes I walk out head to concierge to ask for managernot available but the helpful young lady   followed me to the ladies room and replenished and swept the floor, thank you.<br><br>This was my first dining experience there celebrating my birthday hopefully they improve on sanitation <br> <br>If you cant keep the bathroom clean for customers and employees then i do not want to eat at your establishment!<br><br>Boo

Stopped by here for lunch today with immediate seating!  There was an extended wait for our order, but people watching is fun from the sidewalk patio tables while waiting.  I ordered the Southwestern salad with jalapeños added.  It was very good and the way I wanted it.  The fish tacos my guest ordered was cool on delivery and should have been hot.  The Orange chicken and other orders were satisfactory but nothing to write home about!  This is Avery pleasant dining environment.

I&#39;ve had this for many time back in California, and I went here for cheesecake again! It was great! I enjoyed the new flavor I tried and, same as I did before, I finished the whole slice of cheesecake! I appreciated it! This may be too much for people who don&#39;t like sweets and heavy cheesecakes.

I ordered the factory nachos which is my sons favorite. Since we dont have time to dine in i decided to order to take out. The packaging they did on the Factory Nachos was so dumb. They didnt put anything like a foil before they put the nachos inside the pizza box. They can use a better packaging.

Like one of the earlier reviewers said- This place does give the Cheesecake Factory a bad name.<br>Agreed this is in a mall and does get crowded most of the time over the weekends but when it&#39;s not- I don&#39;t understand what the strategy is in putting your customers on a waitlist despite having plenty of empty tables.<br>The portions are big enough just like at any other Cheesecake Factory.<br>Thrice I have been here and all the three times they got us the molasses(brown) bread late with the meal.<br>Considering that the neighborhood(unless you travel to grove st.) is devoid of good ambience restaurants I might come back.

The food here was good. The chicken wings were really good. I felt the pasta was little dry.<br><br>Talking about the service,it wasn&#39;t great. There was a little delay and waitress was not too attentive.

Came for the grand opening today in my city(jersey city), had a wait of 20 min but I didn&#39;t mind...I noticed it was where pay half used to be...they gave me a sort of pager that would vibrate when I had a table, when it did I got the booth I asked for which was awesome, I was walked to my table by a beautiful hostess...I already kind of knew what I was going to eat so I ordered it which was the chicken costelleta which came with asparagus and a hefty portion of bacon mash potatoes...to start off I received the two breads, I&#39;m going to keep it one thousand it was garbage! BASURA! ...really didn&#39;t like it...but the good part is my main meal was awesome, would recommend it to anyone who does not know what to get off the menu!

Emily was a rock star. She hooked us up with the best service one could ever ask for. She smiled, explained the menu thoroughly and guided my girlfriend and I to exactly what our taste buds where looking for. It was my first experience and will not be my last. I choose to go with the Chicken Madeira and Fried Mac while my girlfriend elected to go with the Chicken Chipotle Pasta. For drinks, I had a Whiskey Smash and she had a Passion Fruit Margarita. I love this place. We&#39;ll be back with more people next time. Everyone deserves to have at least eaten from this establishment once. It&#39;s a sin no to.

Went here for dinner on a Saturday night. I made reservations in advance to avoid a waitlist and wanted a booth. I was called to be seated but I didn&#39;t want that table(wasn&#39;t a booth) and was told it was like a 15 minute wait which was no problem for me considering I arrived 30 mins early for my reservation. 15 minutes was more like 3 because I got seated right away. My rating is 5 stars because the food was amazing. Very tasty. Everything came out hot and within reasonable time. I can&#39;t remember my servers name but she was very nice and helpful. She had short hair I think her name started with an m. Everyone there was nice, even the bussers and food runners checking in on us to make sure everything was good. The only &#34;problem&#34; I had was with the hostess, she sped to the table, put the menus on the edge and then ran away. I understand though it was busy and I don&#39;t know what else they have to really do other than show us to a table so whatever, i guess it just seemed very rushed. I will be back soon however since I had a wonderful experience.

Horrible experience trying to get a table at the place.<br>With half the restaurant empty we allotted a corner table <br>Asked for another one 3 tables down but we&#39;re told that there weren&#39;t enough staff <br>30secs later that table is given to another family <br>The manager told us that was some miscommunication <br>No apologies, the manager just walked back to her counter.<br>No one cared<br>Idk if this is straight up racist but never going to this place again

I don&#39;t know what the deal is with the CCF! Came here since it was located across from the hotel I was staying at thinking it was a safe bet for good food! Well food was mediocre and service was even worse! Hostess acted as we weren&#39;t standing there and I had to ask if we could get a table.....no such luck as we were forced to sit at high table in the bar area. I asked if it was okay that I had a minor in my party and I was surprised when they said yes it was fine....Our server acted as if we were bothering her by being there! She hardly checked on us and by the time it was time to pay we sat there for 10 minutes waiting for her to come and process the check! My husband literally walked around the restaurant trying to locate her so we could pay! I give 2 stars for the so/so food! Plain awful! Glad I was just visiting and don&#39;t have to subject myself to this craziness!

I love the cheesecake factory! The food is always great and most of the time so is the service. I had my usual, crispy chicken costolletta, so yummy!!!! I ordered mac and cheese this time instead of the asparagus it comes with and I got charged extra, I didn&#39;t appreciate that. I wish the waitress would have told me. I usually order a different side since I don&#39;t like asparagus and have never been charged extra. <br>Anyways, my only other gripe is it smelled fishy or like wet socks, just a strange smell.

It was the dirtiest restaurant that i&#39;ve ever visited. we had to ask for changing our forks and knives but our server gave us more dirty one... i couldn&#39;t believe her service... it was awful... she was really unfriendly. no eyecontact. no concern about her customers. i can say this restaurant is the worst cheesecake factory in USA. What a shame.

I&#39;ve been to a few locations in the past but I decided to take my parents to the newly opened Newport location for brunch last Sunday. We were seated quickly and our server was prompt to take orders and have them out to us. We tried the crab hash, creme brûlée French toast, and monte cristo. All dishes were huge portions and true to form for Cheesecake Factory. The coffee was on the weak side so you&#39;re probably better off having your own from one of the places in the mall. All in all, a nice location with nice service. I would bring my parents back again.

By far one of the worst Cheesecake Factory visits in a long time. Front of House Service is lacking at this location but the three stars are for the kitchen, they did the damn thing.  Is order to go next time not to have to deal with the lazy, lackluster service.

Ordered take out.  Arrived and waited patiently before cashier acknowledged me.  Food was very oily, but most surprisingly there was human hair (seems like hair from below the waist) in my takeout.  I didn&#39;t bother going back because sometimes u don&#39;t know if the chef will do anything else to the food.  The 3 items I bought didn&#39;t look a bit appealing.  The only good part of the meal was the free bread.

Ordered pick up several times from Cheesecake Factory in Jersey City. NEVER AGAIN! The food is never consistent with the way they serve it when you dine in. DO NOT order take out from this location. They overcook and burn everything. In addition to that they do not give consistent portions when you take your food to go. Pick up orders are half the portion every time. Every single time we order they mess up at least two of the dishes. Fed up with giving this place several chances.
Food &amp; Service was Amazing! We had a waiter named Jasmyn (With a Y lol) serve a party of 12 &amp; her service was Excellent.

We went to have a family dinner Thururday night and all I can say is the only thing they have going for them is their amazing cheese cake!!!! Other than that don&#39;t bother coming here. Food is blahhhh, wait time to be served is ridiculous. I think we waiting 30 mins just for the waiter to put our originally to go platter off the plate and into a box, to go!! If my hubby didnt need me to drop him off lunch at work I would have left it there! I am never coming back and since then I have warned anyone I know not to go there.

I dont know how they do that but they have tens of choices in their menu and all of them are great! The buffalo strips are something beyond!!!!! I can eat that everyday! And the caramel salted cheesecake, oh my!!! <br>Love cheesecake factory! And Brittany served us, she was reeeally nice and sweet!<br>Just one negative thing all of their restaurants smell weird, like wet cloth and it makes me sick when i enter.. just a small thing :)

Waiting here for our food to come out over 20mins for 2 people os completely unacceptable!  I hate coming here!  It&#39;s NOT EVEN BUSY!  I haven&#39;t come back for a long time again!  Fire the general manager because the people do NOT know how to run this place!   And what&#39;s worse is the couple got their food before us that sat down 5-10mins later!  What the hell!

The food is absolutely amazing and the portions are very large.  The Thai lettuce wraps and miso salmon are mouthwatering delicious.  Unfortunately, the service here is dreadfully slow.  We love going to all of the Cheesecake Factory&#39;s because we love the food and service is usually very good but at this particular location, something is just off.  I definitely recommend the Cheesecake Factory but not this particular location.  Of course if you love cheesecake, this place will certainly satisfy your cravings as there are about 50 available variations.  We try to eat healthy so we typically skip the dessert and also because the main course portions are so large that we are just too full to have dessert at that point.

I had no idea this place was open until i saw it on the malls website. We came out on a saturday late afternoon and had only a 10 min wait for a party of 5 after being told 30 mins.... Not bad! <br><br>Our waitress was efficient and personable and all of our food came out as ordered, hot, and on time. Waitress was very good on our refills both on drinks and bread :)<br><br>Food as usual was good and cheesecakes yummy. Wish they would bring back the pineapple upside down cheesecake. Lol.

Wow!<br>I thought the food would be under rated, but to my surprise the food was better than I thought. It was stated it would be a 45 min wait, so I decided to shop at JCPennys. To my surprise upon arrival I decided to check at the front desk to see, if I was called and I sure was. I never should have left. Yet I had the best seat in the joint, corner table. I hope I can get that table all the time I will request it, near the waiters station. Our Customer Service Host Adan M, was the best 10 stars, Adan proceeded to ask if this was our first time and I stated yes, and he explained the menu in a way that most other restaurants will not do and take out the time to explain. I would recommend you to sit in his section near the bar. Once again I under estimated this place. Never again!

I went there with my colleague and had chicken enchiladas. It was delicious. Nothing different though. Just like any other Mexican restaurant like Chillis. I wasn&#39;t a big fan of cheese cakes until I tried their red velvet cake Cheesecake. It was very yummy and moist. Next time, I do wanna try their Tiramisu cheesecake. They have so many different kinds of cheesecakes that I think one must differently try!!

Great ambience, great hospitality !!! Amazing drinks from the bar !!! Factory Nachos and chicken parm pizza style were mouthwatering, loved it. In cheesecakes, Tiramisu was the best. I&#39;d say great place for celebrations and weekends.

Bartender made my drink wrong and was very short and made it apparent his break was top priority. Wings came out ICE cold, calamari was delicious! Wings came back saltier than i could handle, probably because they refried the already sauced cold wings. The bartender who took mr. Anxious off the shift was a sweetheart. Management need to be more present during lunch/happy hour rush.
Happy hour here is hard to beat. Good drinks and big apps that will leave you full. We came in hungry and had to box things up to take home. Loved the service. Gets busy but for good reason.

My wife and I<br>Wanted to get the<br>World famous CHEESE CAKE <br>from the cheese cake factory<br><br>I&#39;m disabled and can&#39;t stand too long<br>we was told, it&#39;s a &#34;TALK OUT ITEM ONLY&#34;<br>and had to see on this <br>Bench, like homeless bombs !!!!!!<br>Item

I would give it zero stars if I could<br><br>The service is not just Delaaayyyeeeed. - it&#39;s very baaaad<br><br>The salad portions [full sized portion ordered]  are extremely small<br><br>The beer - unless you are seated at the bar - never arrives<br><br>If you cancel the beer order - as it never arrived, and order a double shot of Glenlivet on the rocks<br><br>IT ARRIVES NEAT [NO ICE] - IN A WINE BOWL [I ASSURE YOU IT WAS NOT A WHISKY GLASS]<br><br>And the management is shameless enough to not rectify any of their service related issues - absolutely not apologetic<br><br>AVOID THIS PLACE

It&#39;s been a while since we went to Cheesecake Factory and we are thrilled!! This place is huge and the menu, wow, I think I need 30 minutes to fully digest what&#39;s on the menu!!! We were there around 3:30pm on a Saturday, and they serve lunch portion until 5pm. Scored!!! We ordered the fried mac and cheese appetizer (which was delicious!!!), chicken piccata (lunch portion for $12.95) and chicken and biscuit (full size). Wow that&#39;s a lot of food!!!!!!! Food was pretty good, service was great!! We skipped dessert but I know, I&#39;ll be back!!

First time in the location an I was starving after walking in the mall, (this spot is directly in the mall)<br>Not so bad <br>Anyways yeah I walked in an was seated right away. I was greeted with a nice server who was from down south which you can tell she had a cute ascent.<br><br>I over ordered the portions are huge, from the appetizers which where amazing I had the chicken nachos an some wings. All very very good. <br>Came out fast an hot I guess when I told her I was starving she new I meant it I was 8 months pregnant ready to eat anything lol<br><br>My children&#39;s loves it here, there kids meals are yummy my boys had chicken tenders an frys.<br>Sounds so boring and simple but they actually where really good. <br><br>I enjoyed my entree as well as my husband. <br><br>Now let&#39;s get down to the cheesecakes OMG so many flavors so delicious. How can one control them selfs here. <br>I love cheese cake <br><br>We ordered 3 cheese cake to stay an a huge cake to go not realizing how much an how big of a portion they serve. One can share with literally 3 people it&#39;s huge an very rich and creamy. <br><br>Definitely a good compliment <br><br>All so delicious. Great experience in this location.

Service is absolutely horrible. The waiter rushed us throughout the meal and relentlessly asked to clear our plates even though we were clearly still eating. Now we have our dessert, but we don&#39;t have any utensils and our dinner plates are still stacked on the table - and he is no where to be found. The food was fine but honestly the service here ruined the overall experience. I&#39;m very disappointed in this Cheesecake Factory location. Definitely won&#39;t be back.

We had no wait time since we came in on a Monday night around 9pm. We were greeted by the hostess and sat down right away. Our server James was awesome. He was very attentive and helpful. <br>We ordered the smokehouse burger with sweet potato fries and I had the bow tie chicken pasta with a garlic sauce (I forgot what it&#39;s called). My bf said his burger was pretty good but wished he got more fries since all you get is about a cup full. My pasta was pretty good. It had really good flavors and  I really liked the tomatoes in it. My only thing is it had kind of a burnt aftertaste. Not sure if it was supposed to taste like that or it was the pancetta. Regardless I ate it and it was still good. Probably won&#39;t order that again though. James was great with keeping our cups full and answering any questions we had.<br><br>CHEESECAKE TIME! <br>We ordered two kinds, the red velvet cake and the white chocolate macadamia caramel cheesecake. My boyfriend liked them both. I was pretty meh about the red velvet but the caramel macadamia was soooooo good. Definetly a must try. <br><br> Didn&#39;t spend a fortune and we enjoyed a nice night out. Would be back again soon.

Came in here with my mother in law.  It was first trip to this mall and this area and i must admit, i am NOT a fan of chain restaurants.  But, with the lack of parking in Jersey City these days, this was an easy option. <br>Service was prompt and friendly.  The place was busy and humming.<br>We each had a cocktail and the pineapple moscow mule was quite good!  I ordered the Nashville hot chicken app and while it really was nothing like the hot chicken in Nashville, it was good. <br>We each had a salad, my MIL the chopped which was quite a generous portion and i had the seared tuna salad.  It was good, and not at all a large portion - just enough for lunch.  I will say that for the $19 price tag on this salad, it could have had more than 3 slices of the tuna but that would be my only complaint.  <br>We were seated quickly, waited on promptly, with a waiter who was attentive and not distracting. <br>If you are shopping in the mall, its an easy spot for lunch or dinner.

Worst Cheesecake Factory I&#39;ve EVER been to. Usually the worse part is the wait. Not this time, we were strayed relatively fast but the food...sub par to say the least.  The calamari came out cold and I was less than impressed with the portion size. The majority of it was batter. My entree was not hot, the waiter (who tried his best to satisfy us) offered to &#39;heat&#39; my food up for me but it was still not hot. I will not be returning to this location EVER and will certainly not recommend it anyone.

Somewhat disappointing.  The shrimp were overcooked to the point of  being inedible, although the accompanying pasta was good.  The &#34;chicken pot pie&#34; was a near miss:  a bowl of chicken stew with a disk of puff pastry placed on top as a garnish, not a pie with top and bottom crust.  Much better were the salads:  fresh and a very generous serving, so you may want to share one.  Service was good.
Waited for  a long time and we got our food. And it&#39;s not even good. We ordered the new York steak.

Food, service, ambience... Everything is great! I love cheesecake factory! I visited this restaurant so many times and I always satisfied with their food and service. Everything is great in this restaurant. I highly recommend!
The appetizers and main course was served together. When I reached out to them about it, nothing was done! Never going here again!

I think it&#39;s decent, nothing special. It&#39;s a restaurant chain, with tons of options. Maybe too many options. I&#39;ve never had the cheese cake but they have tons of options for them. I ate the pasta with chicken; very basic. Nice decor, the main floor looks clean, I got a glimpse of the back and I wanted to throw up, may never eat at this location ever again

This is my go to place in the mall. I love the drinks the cheesecakes and the nachos. Been here a couple times and enjoyed it. Service was a Little slow and wait to be seated was a little long but it&#39;s was a busy day when I went so that was expected.

My friend, aunt and I wanted to eat in the cheesecake factory for a long time, I am new to the area and they came with me to celebrate with me. The seating process was very nice and the host was friendly, soon a waiter came and after a couple of minutes we were ready to order. I was the second one to order, chicken parmesan with fries, but as always, I asked for the meal to come with no vegtabels or sauce, I am very picky, and that is what I always ask for, the waiter wrote everything down and left. <br>Halfway through the wait( which was already long by this point) a new waiter came to the tabel and told us she will take care of us from now on, as the first waiter finished her shift. The new waiter was very professional and we kept waiting for the food. First, got her food ny aunt, she was the last to order because it took her a while to decide... then, my friends food arrived. I kept waiting and a couple of minutes later I got my food. It looked just as good as I thought itll be. And just when i was about to grab the sandwich and take a bite i saw tomato picking from it, when i moved the top layer of the sandwich i saw the chicken was covered with sauce(they did remember not to include veggies inside)... no big deal, she wasnt the one to take the order and it wasnt her fault. I asked her to replace my food to the same order but fixed, same as i got, just no sauce now and keep the veggies away. By the time they took my order my friend and aunt aleady started eating. By the time it reached the table, they almost finished their food. I was sad ill dine with them only for a little while, but sadly, when I looked inside, my meal contained vegtables. Furstrated due to the long wait and getting wrong orders again and again, I told my waiter (another one brought the meal) immidietly about what happened before and what happened now. She apologized and called my waiter, she, without hesitation or me asking, said she will call for the manager and theyll see what they will be able to do for me- keep in mind, by that time the other people in my table have already finished the meal. <br>The managar comes to the table after 3 mins  of wait. She said she was sorry about what happen and that she will be happy to pack my meal to go. As a reply I told her &#34; I dont think I will be happy to pay for food that Ill have to eat without my friends&#34; she then replied &#34;so imma erase the meal and thats it&#34; and just left. <br>You had a costumer wait, for an hour watching her group eat, made a mistake on her one dish twice, and then offered nothing to make her feel better? I know no place that ever treats a costumer like that, thats one. But the second thing, is, I left  the restaurant in tears. Im a former anorexic, and Ive been through recovery. Buying food is a big deal for me, and eating outside wasnt a thing I did until last year. So facing my struggles, eating outside, making sure they understood me correctly and then feeling like no one listenes is the worst thing a place could do to someone that has been through what I did. When I eat , I prepare myself mentally for what is about to enter my body, and if that doesnt happen I just give up because to get to the point of eating outside is already hard enough. If getting your food late is furstrating, imagine you would see the food gets to you twice after a long wait but not being able to eat it. To a regular costumer its a bad experience.. so to me? Unbareable. It really is sad to me that I will not go back to the cheesecake factory restaurant. A person that is in charge should knows how to handle those things in a fair way. <br><br>I came hungry and was actually the one who decided on the place. And I was the only one who didnt get her food.

Idk why this cheesecake has low ratings. Everytime i go there they take good care of us .I enjoy the food and the atmosphere. The server was attentive and got our food out fast. My fav was the carne Asada and the choc tuxedo cheesecake!!!! And baby you can never go wrong with the Mac and cheese balls!  See ya soon!

Service was extremely slow and I&#39;m being polite. Also, it takes a lot of b**ls to charge this much for a drink(12.75 for a pineapple mojito). It would have been nice if the price was on the menu. This isn&#39;t NYC!<br>food was ok, but now i have agita feeling like i was ripped off.

Clean ****<br>Food ***<br>Service ****<br>Over all was ok, salty but great flavor <br>Just don&#39;t let them sit you all the way in the corner on a Monday when the place is empty that was rude! I say NO WAY!!<br>Anyway I refused and I sit where I want it period!!!<br>Had a great time with my wife

Convenient place and has a lot of choices! The food and service are both good. For most of the nights and weekends this place is packed. However, I really have some problems with their dishes! There are A LOT water marks on the dishes every time which really annoyed me!

With Cheesecake Factory, once you been to one, you know what to expect. The differencing factor is the wait time and service. According to Yelp current standing it is at a 3 star. Experience can change from time of day to server. Our luck, it seems to error on the later. We arrived before the Church crowd and baby wagons started to invade. We got a cheerful server Jennifer that was on point and just made our day. She was quick witted and just did everything right. I got my usual staple of Thai lettuce wrap as it is more than enough as a meal plus it is plenty healthy. Everyone else got their usual dishes, veggie burger, burgers and Wellness Salad. You can&#39;t finish off without having what the name of the place. We decided to try the Birthday Cake and Salted Caramel Cheesecake. Also our new favorite flavor!  Food quality is as you expect from the Chain restaurant, consistent. I&#39;ll have to say this was probably the best service and experience at a Cheesecake Factory to date. What better than to finish the morning with a casual stroll along the waterfront, baby Geese, and getting back to the other side of the river.

If I could I would give this location zero stars. Just extremely slow and inattentive service. Our waitress apologized multiple times explaining that she had been busy running all over the place. It was the night before Valentines Day so you would think they&#39;d staff accordingly. <br><br>After ordering our drinks it took about 15 minutes before we saw our waitress again to take our food order. Then it was another half hour for our food to arrive. There were 5 people in our party and 2 of the orders came incorrectly. For one, a well done steak came out very red/pink. Didn&#39;t bother asking for a new order because of how long we had already been waiting. <br><br>We also overheard the table next to us complaining to their waitress about their orders coming out wrong as well. Unfortunately we could not find a manager to vent our frustrations. At this point all I can say is good luck on Valentines Day.
Dynamite shrimp . Cant stop eating. Its delicious. Cant ask more good than this. Amazing food.

I&#39;d been to several Cheesecake Factory restaurants before and had relatively pleasant experiences, but this one was absolutely the worst...might even be the second worst experience I have ever had at a casual restaurant.<br><br>Took around 20 minutes to be seated...which was not unheard of. Then it took about 20 minutes for someone to come take our orders. We weren&#39;t offered water or bread. Also the silverware was dirty and laying on the bare table (with no napkin)! Finally we place our order for the appetizer and drinks. After about a half hour, we go the drinks, but not the appetizer. <br><br>30 MORE minutes pass, and we are wondering where our appetizer (nachos and guac) is. The server (who was very nice), said they accidentally gave it to another table. We then had to wait another 10 minutes to get the appetizer. By the time we got it, our entrees had come out. We didn&#39;t even finish the appetizer. <br><br>I ordered tasteless, greasy, Chicken Piccata, which looked like something you&#39;d get at an army base. The portions were really small (it was like chicken tenders drenched in greasy butter sauce), and the noodles were overcooked. My friend ordered enchiladas and told me the ones I made at home were better than CCFs. We decided to ask for water, and it took the server 10 more minutes to bring the water! <br><br>By this time we were annoyed and just wanted to go. We didn&#39;t even order the cheesecake because we wanted to get the hell out of there! We got the check, and they didn&#39;t even offer to comp the nachos appetizer. We paid for the meal, and decided that this would be our last time at CCF in Newport Mall.

The service in this establishment is beyond poor, as we sit here during happy hour when one would think they would want to turn tables, we have. Ow been sitting for 20 minutes and had to grab our own menus and still no server. But more to come.

Is there anyway Cheesecake Factory would consider making smaller cheesecake slices? 1500-1700 calories for a slice of cheesecake is... disgusting. I think your customers would appreciate smaller portions which would reduce selling price. This is a prime example as to why America is so damn fat. Portions are ridiculous. <br><br>If you&#39;re going to splurge on a cheesecake, I recommend the Celebration cheesecake which is basically a funfetti cake/cheesecake. <br><br>I hate the fact that they got rid of my favorite salad, the luau salad, from back in the day. But their new menu is pretty good (at least the salads). I recommend the chicken, mango, avocado salad and the Sheila&#39;s chicken and avocado salad.<br><br>I have never dined here but only have gotten take out a few times. Customer service was fine / sufficient.

I come here very frequent and when I do I always always always get the chipotle chicken pasta. Its my ultimate favorite plate on the menu in their massive options. I also occasionally order their calamari which is also great. There seems to always be a HUGE crowd at this establishment which is good. Luckily I was able to find a place in the Bar to sit and not wait on that long wait list to get a table. I never had any issues with the place. Only issue is that they messed up on my orders a couple of times but they always rectify it by either giving it to me for free or offering me something else which is always a plus.

Waiter was very good and nice<br><br>Food - took 30 minutes and one of the items came out cold though they did redo it, though it was just less gross when warm (avoid the nachos; it&#39;s mostly cheese whiz and the burger i had was completely underwhelming; I&#39;d much rather have a burger from five guys)<br><br>if you have to eat at the [ghetto] mall, just get something quick and cheap at the food court; don&#39;t overspend and get something gross at this factory

This is by far THE BEST CHEESECAKE FACTORY IVE EVER BEEN TOO! The food was amazing! I mean finger licking good AMAZING! Not to mention our waitress was very nice! Extremely knowledgeable on the dishes and very courteous! We ordered so many things like the firecracker salmon and the mac &amp; cheese balls that was my favorite! I will upload all the picture so you can see greatness for yourself! This location I will definitely recommend!

I was really hungry for cheesecake this one day so i walked in and they were like hey. you can sit down at a table. it was really big for a cheesecake cafe. then they came out with what looked like Harry potter and the gobbo of fire, (you know.. the book) but when I opened it up.. it was... Chinese food, Mexican food, Pizza, Italian food, Hamburgers, Seafood, Southern food, sandwiches, Sushi, spagget. It was all the foods in the world! Super big menu! I forgot why i even was there in the first place there and i ended up getting a hamburger, but it took me an hour to order because i am not a fast reader so it took a while to get through the menu.<br><br>I think its a good place if you have picky eaters because they have absolutely every food you could think of, they have very nice food presentation, and it kicks any TGIF type place in the butthole because its actually really good for this kinda style of restaurant.<br><br>oh yeah I almost forgot. i got a hambuger with fried macaroni and cheese ball on it! It was kinda fun!

Great food. Great enviorment. Worth the price. <br>I had a rare stake. It was the one of the most tender stakes i had in along time. The crab bites were sweet and savory at the same time. You could taste the real crab. I recommend this for a good time. It really is a great addition to the newport mall.
Ill keep it short. I found a live bug in my salad and when i told the waiter he said the salad was organic...

Worst place to eat in jersey city. Jersey city is right next to NYC one of the greatest cities to eat anywhere in America, so if you want to eat good food just spend 2.75 on a subway ride and go to the city. I haven&#39;t had a worst experience anywhere in JC upto now. To begin with my experience we went on Thursday night at 9:30 pm for dinner. Firstly I went to the counter to ask for a table for 3 and they gave me a buzzer and told me it&#39;s a 15 min wait while half of the restaurant was empty, but that&#39;s ok  maybe that&#39;s their policy. I waited and after 10 mins the buzzer went off, I took it to the counter and the lady took it without telling me where the table is. I was just standing there waiting for her to guide after another 10 mins I asked so where&#39;s the table since you took the buzzer she tells me go stand on another side. There were 10 people who came after me and got seated before me, thank god for another server who came and asked me why are you standing here so I told him well my buzzer went off I&#39;m waiting for my table, he asked for my name and told me I was looking for you since the past 10 mins we have your table ready come with me. So in short the 15 min wait turned into a 35 min wait. <br>Once we got seated we were given the menus while the server took another 15 mins to come take our order. That&#39;s ok but once she took the order she vanished in thin air and was nowhere to be seen for good 20 mins, by then I was done with the place so I called the manager and asked him about the update on the food he said it&#39;s on it&#39;s way so I politely asked him to serve us atleast the on the house bread basket, he said it should be out any min so I asked him isn&#39;t that served with the menus he said yes it is I&#39;ll get back to you, he went in the kitchen and never came around us again. <br>So yes no bread basket was served to us, we finally got our appetizer served after 30 mins which were the nachos and they were I would say 6 on 10. The food came after another 10 mins, out of which the bang bang shrimps were awful (if I could give it a number it was -5 on 10) but the pasta was nice. All in all a peaceful dinner which should have ended by max 11 ended around midnight. <br>Again I would repeat PLEASE DONT go to the cheese cake factory <br>3 big thumbs down

HORRIBLE SERVICE!! I would like to repeat what so many ppl have already said. <br>This place has HORRIBLE SERVICE. Pathetic ! <br>The order took 35 minutes for two dishes !!! How much time does it take to make Spicy Chicken over rice fellas ????? <br>They say the dish took longer than usual to make. After 35 min, all We got was cold food. They have no explanation to that. It only means that the food was ready sometime back and they didn&#39;t get it to the table. The food was taken back to kitchen and when the re-served one dish had too much salt in it. By then our appetite was over and we got food packed cuz we couldn&#39;t eat. They sent their manager to talk to us who turned out to be another waiter.  Bunch of a**holes and liars work here. The whole management &amp; staff needs to be &#39;fired&#39;. Even after all this, I had to PAY for the late food !! <br><br>We are never coming back. And neither We will recommend this place to anyone. There is a reason why this place got 2.5 star as compared to other cheesecake factories.<br><br>Re-Edit after reading other reviews--<br>Cheesecake Factory Guest Services ! Plz don&#39;t bother apologizing for poor service or thanking for honest feedback. Your manager needs to be fired for consistent poor reviews from so many ppl !

First we came in and the hostess said 30 min wait , 1h after she said 5 min , 15 min after when we asked to see the manager we got a seat . After we waited another 20 minute the waitress came to take the order , we ordered everything at once , and then it was six of us , we got the food all 6 at different times . If the service was better the food is not bad , bur service is not worth coming back

We just visited this location and I have to say it was the most disappointing experience at Cheesecake Factory I have ever had.<br>The air is very stale in this restaurant and whomever designed the HVAC did a poor job.  The restaurant also has a mildew like smell.<br>To start, there were a lot of empty tables but the wait was still 15 minutes. We were seated and given menu&#39;s.<br>We ordered a passion fruit margarita (served in a martini glass) which was extremely too sweet, again it taste like chemicals and not freshly made. Our server brought us water but for some reason put no ice in it so it was luke warm. <br>We didn&#39;t get any bread, and like the table next to us we had to ask our server for it.<br>For the appetizer we got the zucchini, mushroom and avocado batter dipped ($6.95). There were 2 pieces of avocado and the rest was all soggy mushroom and zucchini pieces. Not good at all. They also threw Parmesan on top of it which made the sogginess worse.<br>For the entree I ordered the Luau Salad which did not taste fresh at all. The salad was wilted and soggy. They also put way too much dressing in the salad. The crisp part was drowning in dressing, which had a chemical taste. Nothing tastes fresh.<br>We decided to try the strawberry cheesecake (since it my husband&#39;s first time to Cheesecake Factory) and the strawberries ARE NOT fresh (like the menu states) but drowning in a strawberry concentrate and is extremely sugary and taste like corn syrup.<br>Very disappointing experience. The food sucks as well as the ambiance.<br>Complete waste of $70 (we also were not given an itemized receipt when we asked for the check, and were unable to locate our server to get one).
Other than the fact that the wait is pretty long, all is well. After trying out most of the cheesecakes on the menu, I feel like Godiva Cheesecake has become my personal favorite.
I had Shrimp Scampi at this Cheescake location and it was amazing!!!! The service was also amazing, I highly recommend this location!

Ordinary Cheesecake Factory; however the wait times can be very long due to little food choices in the immediate area. Some of the entrees are pretty good but I find the food here is very salty. It&#39;s like they pour half a bottle of salt on everything..it truly ruins the food in my opinion.

We have been here a few times now. We sometimes collect a cheesecake to go whenever we have come to the mall for a movie at the amc. We liked the flatbread, nachos, avocado toast in general. We also tried thai lemon chicken and veg. burrito which were good too.

Made it in with a girlfriend on a Friday night for drinks &amp; apps. It was busy so we went straight to the bar &amp; luckily someone one was leaving, so we had a zero wait time. The table was cleaned up right away &amp; menus were put down.  Our waitress was friendly &amp; took the time to review &amp; give drink recommendations. <br><br>I had already read other yelp reviews, so went in the expectation of slow service, which I can&#39;t disagree with those reviews. <br>It was Friday night, busy, realize the place is still new &amp; in no rush, so it didn&#39;t bother me. Apps &amp; drinks came out in a timely matter once the order was put in, all was tasty &amp; satisfying! The waitress did spend time at our table when she did come around &amp; was very pleasant.  <br><br>Overall it was a good experience! I&#39;m sure I&#39;ll be back &amp; hopefully the service will be speedier at that time.

My bf and I were craving cheesecakes so obviously we came to the kindom of cheesecakes. Leo was attentive and gave us descriptions of some flavors he thought we would enjoy. I also got a tropical smoothie. Amazing. The cheesecakes were Oreo and Peanut butter Reese&#39;s soooo delish!  This place hit our sweet spot

It&#39;s the Cheesecake Factory. It&#39;s a chain. It&#39;s reliable and you know what to expect. <br><br>I came here with my husband and two week old baby as we were walking past and there was ten minutes left of happy hour. Two drinks later and we were happy. The entire bar area is happy hour from 4-6pm so we ordered a beer and a cocktail which were both great. We also ordered a factory nachos which was $5.95 alongside many other happy hour apps. The plate that arrived was humongous! Seriously crazy sized - we didn&#39;t even finish it. Best value for $6 ever. <br><br>So all in all, a great pit stop when we needed a seat and a chill out. It&#39;s not fine dining, and it&#39;s not crappy. It is what it is. Just don&#39;t take me there on an anniversary or special occasion!

I wish I had an option of half a star.I am a big fan of cheesecake factory and that was the first time when I went out with my friends to this new location, we waited for 45 minutes and at the end the expereince was awful! I ordered Rigatoni Pasta, it was raw, extremely Al-Dente(So hard to chew) and had no taste.. Talked to manager had him changed to Four Cheese pasta for To-Go! When I got back they had packed Chicken Pasta for me.. I have been vegetarian whole of my life. This was the most disgusting experience everrrr...Not going back to this location and maybe not any of their franchises.

Upon arrival the host/hostess/thing at the counter greeted us with sass and attitude. Told us it would be a 15 minute wait on a Tuesday night (8:30) with practically no one in the restaurant. Once seated for another 15 minutes the waitress did not come greet us or offer us drinks. We approached the host/hostess/thing again and instead of apologizing and letting our waitress know he/it gave a loud and unapologetic OK. We then saw him/it go to our waitress and engage in laughs for a couple minutes. We decided that these unprofessional children would not ruin our day more than they already have so we ate next door at Zinburger. As someone who has been to other cheesecake factories I know that this location does not represent all of them. The staff needs to be retrained and some people need to be cut. Unfortunately not everyone is qualified for a job and management should be able to see that.
Always like to go there. plates are gigantic and delicious. My favorite dish is shrimp jambalaya,  you should go and try
Nothing to see here...Standard Cheesecake Factory you know the deal. Although for some reason the service here is lacking. Prefer the location in the Shops at Riverside in Hackensack.

Service was good and the food was great. Specifically, the Espresso martini was amazing! It was a bit confusing though when entering in from the mall entrance. I couldn&#39;t see the maitre&#39;d station because it&#39;s back was to facing me when I came in. I guess it makes sense that they want to face the main entrance, but probably would be better to have it sideways.

Wait was surprisingly long but likely because of the holiday week. Staff are nice but slow and not good with busy hours. Had to ask for the bread which came out with entrees. Food was alright. Drinks were okay. Huge space though.

Honestly last night was my first an last visit!! The place is beautiful but they need better seating arrangements for customers who are waiting for over an hour just to be seated. We waited outside because there was just too many people waiting to be seated. As we waited out side the restaurant too many teenagers where walking past I was wondering if I was going to have front row tickets to see a fight break out. Honestly I felt unsafe for the little girl I had with me and for my boyfriends safety because security wasn&#39;t doing there job!<br><br>So after a hour and a half the buzzer finally rings we had sometime to look at the menu on our phone and knew what we wanted. I ordered  pasta Da Vinci it was awesome. My boyfriend ordered the bacon bacon burger he loved it. And the little lady had the cheese pizza for kids and that was a thumbs up in her book!! <br><br>The wait staff needs better training. We had to keep reminding the waitress to bring out our drinks more then three times and when she finally did of course we finished our sodas not a minute after we got them. And we had to keep reminding her to bring the kid size milkshake she needed to keep checking on. All in all the food was good. The wait was horrible and the waitress was below average I don&#39;t see myself visiting this Cheesecake Factory in the near future. I rather visit another location with more staff experience.
The roasted pear and blue cheese flatbread was yummy. Blueberry mojito very refreshing. And service is nice. Our hostess was super nice.

The food is good but the service is terrible!<br><br>I know this is a new spot thats why there is so many people. So when i went here, i got one of those buzzer things like to put you on a waiting list. the assistant said it would take 40 minutes. so we went and walked around the mall waiting for the buzzer to beat. around an hour later, still hasnt buzzed. so went back to cheesecake, my aunt complained why it hasnt buzzed, and the person said that they had paged the name on the list. ???<br>they changed the buzzer and put us on the top of the list. 20 minutes later, they get us a table. we order food. food is great. but the waitress keeps coming back to us asking if the food is good as if she hasnt asked it the last 3 times already. we take the food as take out.<br><br>overall, service to get a table is so crazy. it was only a table for 2 for us so wasnt a big of a deal. although if you are coming in big groups, i advice you to come 2 hours before you plan on eating here.

Came here for the first time on a Thursday night, the restaurant was busy but not packed. Our server was nice and friendly, but we waited 30 minutes for our entrees and the &#34;Garlic Noodles with Chicken&#34; came out to be very bland. I had to add lots of salt to make it somewhat more flavorful. The noodles were not garlicky at all! The Chicken and Biscuits came out okay but the biscuits were dry and hard.<br><br>Very disappointed about the quality of food. Even though service was decent, but I would not come back. The food court in the mall would be better choices.

First time trying the new Cheesecake Factory in JC. Great service and clean establishment. Serving are huge as they are known for. Food was well cooked and seasoned. Our waiter was great gave us the history of the restaurant, was nice to learn. I will definitely recommend this location and we will be back again. There was plenty for a hungry picky teenager to choose from, he was very satisfied. And my to go strawberry cheesecake was delicious.

Great new option in the Newport area. I have been here twice for lunch and it does get very crowded around 12:00. They have great lunch specials which are generously portioned and reasonably priced. I had the chipotle chicken pasta (pictured) very tasty and filling! Staff is extremely friendly and accommodating.  Will definitely be back!

It was our first time to come here and we were there on a Wednesday night. Although there was a queue, we were seated right away. We were surprised when we saw the serving; it was huge. The menu has a wide selection. Their cheesecakes are really delicious.

Walked in &amp; the hostess&#39; had their backs to the front door. One turned around &amp; asked how many without really even looking at us. For a table of 2 she estimated a 15 minute wait.. cool... <br><br>We went to sit at the bar. The bartender Alex had great energy the entire time. I had a Jameson &amp; Ginger for my first round, then a pineapple mojito from their cocktail menu. Both were good.. <br><br>After 25 min of waiting my friend &amp; I decided to just eat at the bar.. we order the ari tartare and potato tots for app. I liked the tartare, but the overwhelming amount of ginger was killing it for me. I might be a drama queen because I&#39;m just not a fan of ginger.. potato tots were fine. I didn&#39;t care for them either way..<br><br>I ordered the crispy chicken costa-something for an entree. Mashed potatoes, bomb. Asparagus, bomb. Chicken, bomb. I would come back no hesitation, &amp; I&#39;ll probably keep to the bar. The place seemed packed and the table service seemed slow from what I saw. I&#39;m disappointed in myself for being too full for dessert. Next time

Went there for the first time last night.  Had to wait 40 minutes for a table but chalk that up to the Holiday season and all the shoppers in the mall. My friend ordered a margarita when he took the 1st sip he discovered that instead of salt on the rim of the glass they put sugar.  Totally ruined the drink. <br><br>Menu is extensive, at least 6 pages. Food ranges from burgers to pasta dishes to burritos. Had crab cakes for an appetizer which were pretty good. Then I had the 4 cheese pasta with chicken.  Had to add salt and pepper to give it some flavor otherwise it was a bit blandness<br><br>My friend had the burrito supreme which lived up to its name  (12&#34;)  which was pretty good definitely worth ordering again.  Portions were plenty full.  Didn&#39;t have room for cheesecake had to get it to go.<br>I&#39;ll go back again after the holidays to give it another chance.
Pros: great food, amazing deserts<br><br>Cons: long waiting times both for seating and for food.<br><br>Overall: still worth it. Go for the plain cheesecake as desert.
Miserable hostess! Server never came to the table! We left! Last minute Christmas Eve shopping and no time for attitude and nonsense from Cheesecake Factory staff.

Went on a Friday evening and the restaurant was busy but the crowd and the wait was manageable. We had high expectations for the desserts but did not know what to expect with the rest of the food. It turned out that both entrees that we had, the Chicken Bellagio and the Miso Salmon, we&#39;re excellent. Ironically it was the cheesecakes (Salted Caramel and Chocolate Tuxedo Cream) that didn&#39;t overwhelm us - they were okay. Would definitely go back for the entrees that we had but would try something else for dessert.  Our server Tamara was also extremely friendly and helpful though she was stretched thin at times.

Started coming here when first opened, came here today with Family and it was terrible.<br><br>Food + 10<br>Service - 100 <br><br>We were seated as soon as we walked and about 15 minutes went by and a server came up and asked if we were being taken of.<br><br>I answered no and since we waited so long we were ready to order the whole dinner appetizers/dinner and even desert.<br><br>When the appetizers came, one of them was not what was ordered so that was taken back and right one was bought to us shortly.<br><br>We had to ask for bread 3 times from three different servers and finally the bread arrived.<br><br>Now it was time for dinner and 3 out of the 4 dinners ordered arrived so we all waited to eat and about 20 minutes later we had to ask the server where the dinner was, she went back to check and came back later on and bought the much awaited dinner which by this time all the rest of our food was cold.<br><br>The server stated that the manager would be coming to our table shortly.<br><br>The manager arrived and stated he was sorry that the order was delayed !!!!!!! That was all he said !!!!!! WTF<br><br>Dinner taste was very good and now it was time for coffee and desert. Coffee came out and had to ask the server for sugar and that was also a project.<br><br>OMG :-( get me out of here.<br><br>Not looking for Freebie, hopefully the management staff would see this write up and use it as a training tool so that the Cheesecake Factory of Jersey City maintains the great standard of food and exceptional service as in all of the other Cheesecake restaurants.

I&#39;ve been to other CF before but it was my first time at the Newport location. Nice set up. No wait for their &#34;patio&#34; which is an area where they have tables set up in the mall. Server was great. We were dining with our baby and she made sure we had everything we needed. I ordered their skinnylicious lemon Garlic shrimp and it was delicious although very small (hence the skinny part). The cheesecake was amazing like always. I&#39;d come back to this location.

I am very disappointed of this location, as a big fan of Cheesecake factory I can say that this is the worst location I have ever visited at.<br>First when we stepped into the restaurant we had to wait over 25 min Jut to be seated, when they finally found a table for us it was out of the restaurant where they had over 10 empty tables, I really could not figure out why they let us wait so long.
